Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: Rob S
Reviews.Content: In a neighborhood with many lodging behemoths, this comparatively small hotel distinguishes itself with exceptionally attentive, personal and friendly customer service. When I've stayed at some of the larger establishments, you can get lost in the crowd, and feel like a number. Here, everyone knows your name, and goes out of their way to make your stay the best it can be. Bernardo (the General Manager) makes all his guests feel important,and his front desk is top notch. I've stayed with them a couple of times in the past month, and the accomodations are everything you can expect from a well run Courtyard hotel. I travel to the Boston area often, and will always make this hotel my first choice

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff made this a great trip!”
Reviews.Author: BeWell4life
Reviews.Content: I was at conference in Boston during the transformer fire where the majority of the area was without power. Although for part of our stay we had no electricity, the staff was so wonderful and helpful it made the matter much more tolerable. Their willingness to relocate us to another hotel and do what they could to make a challenging situation doable was truly amazing. The location was perfect to walk to everything. The rooms clean and bright. I will definitely return because of the staff. The customer service was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: LitBusybee
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong when staying at a hotel that's in such a prime location, that is affordable, with a quaintness that almost lets you forget you are in the city. The only variable, could be the staff. YET THE STAFF remains constant and consistent. There hasn't been one stay where I have seen anything less than 200% from every member on staff. They make the already perfect venue- an experience of perfection.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our experience there”
Reviews.Author: denisereiss
Reviews.Content: We arrived exhausted, and the friendly front desk staff looked after us with fast service and a delightful room, even though we arrived early. The location was perfect for our walk to the Museum of Fine Arts and evening event at the Mass Historical Society, then onto the T for a Cambridge event. The room was most comfortable and check-out was a breeze. Complimentary coffee in the lobby was much appreciated. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “DGNZ”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: I found Courtyard Copley Square quite by chance as a first time visitor to Boston - what good fortune. Don't judge the hotel by its facade! The hotel is very tidy, the staff very good and the rooms and facilities are excellent. The hotel is is very well placed, close the Boylston ST and Newberry St with parking across the road. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Tadju
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the hotel several times. Each visit a delight --- it's really like staying with friends. The staff is outstanding; helpful, cheerful, willing to assist and eager to please. Rooms are quite large and very well out-fitted. Perfectly clean, well stocked and comfortable. It's truly a boutique hotel nestled under the huge Marriott umbrella. Location ideal for shopping and acces to excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Huge Room”
Reviews.Author: ejan
Reviews.Content: It doesn't look like much from the outside, and the lobby's small... but the room had 2 queen beds and was huge! Very comfortable beds - with great big quilts and lots of pillows! Public parking was across the street. Breakfast was good too. By the way, we had a phenomenal rate - only $99. What a deal! I'd definitely recommend... especially if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Copley Place”
Reviews.Author: Carolann74
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel experience. Helpful staff, clean updated hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: cvandenbraak
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights. Checkin quick, room clean with everything we needed. Buffet breakfast was good, nothing great. Staff was extremely helpful with directions and dinner suggestions. Anything we needed was not a problem to them, would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed the night on New Years Eve. The hotel and staff were top notch! We were greeted by the General Manager (Mr. Gubert?) upon arrival. He couldnt have been more helpful with recommending a great restaurant and sites to see. Breakfast in the restaurant was put out early the next morning which allowed us to eat before we caught an early flight on New Years Day. A delicious selection and omlets to order! Very impressive! We will definetly return to this hotel during our next trip to Boston. WS

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit!”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: Once again another great stay at the Courtyard Copley! Always nice to be greeted by name and remembered by all of the staff! Can't wait for my next trip back to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Jodi A
Reviews.Content: One of the best parts of staying here is how friendly everyone is. The staff always has a smile and a kind word. Beyond that, one evening they set up free massages and wine. Simply wonderful. The rooms are pretty and modern. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You will not go wrong if u stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: 346nicgab
Reviews.Content: They front desk was super helpful and accomadating. Clean. Every request I had was fulfilled. Cookies to snack on. Good location. A little pricey but worth it to stay in a great part of boston!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, excellent location, but who turned off the heat??”
Reviews.Author: jolisart
Reviews.Content: I travel as much as 15 days a month sometimes on business, and I have come to trust not only certain brands, but the reviews on tripadvisor. I chose this location based on the reviews on this site, and the fact that I trust Marriott. They weren't wrong at all! If you are looking for a nice business location, or a get away, this hotel is great! The location is perfect, easy to reach, and within walking distance of many sites, restaurants, etc. It is also within walking distance of the subway. The room was a nice size, with large, historical-style floor to ceiling windows, and the bathroom well-appointed. The folks working were very knowledgeable about where to eat, go, etc. The only complaint I had was the last night of my stay it was snowy and cold. Right before I went to bed, I realized that the heat was not as hot as it could have been. I turned it up, but when I woke up during the night, I realized the heat was not working. While I didn't call the front desk(I was traveling alone, and a call to maintenance at 4am was not what I needed to do), I did mention this upon checkout. The temp in my room was around 60degrees the morning I left. The front desk clerk's response to my concern was "well, sometimes people get hot, and so we turn off the main heat, so your unit in the room was just blowing cold air." I advised how cold it got, and that I could understand that during in between temps might warrant a cooler room, but this was BOSTON, in WINTER, and couldn't folks in rooms that were warm simply turn down their heat? There are individual heating units in rooms for a reason. Don't get me wrong....my stay was marvelous, and folks were very friendly, but no heat? I would just be aware of it during the winter months. And call if it happens. I plan to stay here again, and definitely during the warmer months.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne W
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several hotels in Boston, some are supposed to be nicer, but we have found this to be the best, most comfortable place to stay when visiting relatives in the area. The staff is warm and welcoming, the rooms are comfortable, clean and nicely decorated. The internet is free and easy to sign on to. We have stayed in rooms with views of the front and the back of the hotel and both are pleasing. We look forward to our next visit to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay near Copely Square”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property and the service and accomodations were excellent. Highly recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LConrad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while passing through to CT on my way down the coast from Maine. I truly felt this hotel has well-trained staff and is one of the best hotels in the Boston area. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great nights stay and great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Miken1963
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came up for a two night stay ...to attend a business event ....the event was actually at the Fairmont on Saturday and that room was paid for by a business associate....but our Friday night stay here at the Courtyard was perfect .....exceptional check in and the front desk service was above what most people would expect!! This is our second time at this hotel in the last few years but I wouldn't stay anywhere else .... Why pay these other hotels ( within blocks ) hundreds more ..... This place is clean comfortable and reasonable ... We'll be back again

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the heart of Boston (Copley Square)”
Reviews.Author: Ken M
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and pleasure always staying at Marriott hotels and the Courtyard Marriott in Bostonâ€™s Copley Square is my favorite. I call it my home away from home. It has a wonderful Boston charm; large clean rooms; excellent service and a front desk team that is exceptional. Itâ€™s located near wonderful restaurants, shopping, Prudential convention center and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJMaggie
Reviews.Content: I thought I had made a reservation at the Marriott across the street where I have stayed before. However, I am glad for the switch! Courtyard by Marriott was a pleasant surprise: Friendly staff, lovely, quiet and large room. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, very nice room”
Reviews.Author: Clydenyc
Reviews.Content: If I could give three thumbs up, I would. We booked in advance and paid $119 a night--might have been a special weekend rate. Parking is extra though--$45 a day for valet parking. Our room was spacious with a kingsize bed, a plush reading chair, and a big bay window looking north on Exeter Street with views of classic Boston architecture. It was pretty cold so we booked meals just a block or a couple of blocks away at well-known restaurants; you have your choice of those very close by, as well as a lot of shopping possibilities The staff was very helpful in showing us how to get to an event in another part of the city we were attending and were overall very nice to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for us”
Reviews.Author: windviewer1
Reviews.Content: We were planning a vacation car-trip to the Canadian Maritimes and hoped to include a few days in Boston on the return. We wanted to see the July 4th Fireworks show over the Charles River and also view the Chihuly Glass exhibit at the Mus of Fine Arts. The Courtyard by Marriott in Copley Sq, was perfectly located between both venues. Though we booked it for convenience, it turned out to be a charming stay in itself -- right in the middle of Boston. Clean rooms adequately furnished and a nice restaurant for breakfast just inside. The staff couldn't have been nicer with the parking and holding our bags. Reasonably priced, we would definitely stay there again on our next visit and recommend it highly to others especially if you just want to stroll around the city and not do a lot of driving.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbRose
Reviews.Content: I was there the week of January 9-13, had a very nice stay. Everyone I dealt with at the hotel was nice. Nice sturdy solid hotel. They didn't leave too much of the old world charm inside, but is still a neat place. I had corner room on the 7th floor looking toward Boylston, not a great view, but okay. The room was nice, very comfortable bed. The bathroom was great a little cold because of the floor to ceiling window next to the john. I really like the desk set up. Good wireless internet. This hotel does not connect directly to Prudential Center, I thought it did, but it's hard to tell from the Prudential Center maps. So if you are going there you do have to walk outside about three blocks. Okay if the weather is not horrible. Lots of dining options around the hotel, I was feeling a little under the weather and ordered in. The menus they had at the front desk were not that great. I would suggest using DiningIn if you want delivery. They have a variety of restaurants on their website available most with no additional delivery charge. The Breakfast at the hotel, not so much, it was included in my room but I would have done better grabbing something on the way in. I prefer the Hampton's inclusive breakfast, especially the to go bags. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: StanleyPalombo
Reviews.Content: Less than two blocks from Newbury Street and Copley Plaza, the Marriott Court is a comfortable and perfectly located hotel at a reasonable price. (We had a sizable discount when we stayed there.) It's the old, dignified and charming part of town, with its lovely row houses and lively shops, the great Romanesque Revival churches of Richardson and the famous Boston Public Library. You can walk to your heart's content, but the Metro is right there. The hotel is unpretentious but gives you everything you want in accommodations and service.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: LIGINI
Reviews.Content: Smaller boutique-type hotel right near Prudential Center. Nicely furnished, and our room had a huge (12') cushioned balcony window seat. Room nicely furnished, large size. Only minus' was my bed seemed to have a "depression" in the center, and some loose wallpaper in bathroom adjacent to tub. (Also, no free breakfast as in Courtyard suburban locations.) Nonetheless, minor annoyances (my in-laws had adjoining room with no complaints.) Location is convenient - one block to subway, and two blocks to shops and restaurants on Newbury Street. Street and our room (8th floor) was extremely quiet. I would stay again and recommend this hotel. Tip: Forget the $ 42 valet parking, and self-park across the street ($25 for 24 hours with internet coupon from Central Parking.)

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could give more than 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: waltredmen
Reviews.Content: The best hotel experience I've ever had. Helpful and very friendly staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds and a great breakfast. From top to bottom fantastic!!! The staff should be commended. I couldn't ask for anything more from a hotel. I am looking foward to my next trip to boston.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: My buddy got us tickets to the Bruins game and we stayed here for the night. It was a little tricky to find, but I tend to misread directions anyway. Be cautious if using mapquest. My number one concern is always customer service. I never want or need my butt kissed, but service is so bad in so many places this day, you want to at least feel like you have someone's attention. About 2 minutes after entering, the general manager approached me friend and I, wished me a happy birthday and said to enjoy the Bruins game(obviously having mentioned this when making the reservations). The gentleman at the desk was quick and friendly. Pretty much top to bottom, the service was just right and exactly how it should be; professional, courteous and friendly without the sense you sometimes get that someone is telling you to have a nice day just because it's their job to tell you to have a nice day. Everyone seemed to geniunely care about their job and hotel. And me. :) The room was big and clean, breakfast was delicious, valet service was quick and painless. Just overall, pretty much exactly what you want from a hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place for the price”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborMiBob
Reviews.Content: This property is surrounded by a number of pricier hotels (including the very similarly named Marriott Copley, a different place), but it's fine for the price. My room was a king that was well appointed for the price, including a good bed and simple-to-use alarm clock (as opposed to the more and more common hotel offering that requires a manual and lots of luck just to set the alarm, one of my pet peeves about modern hotels). The Internet (wired and wireless) was free, reliable, and fast, and the room had a quite usable pullout computer table. A few gripes: The room temperature controls took a while to figure out, but worked fine once I did. The hotel breakfast room had a buffet (not included; it ran about $10 for the continental and $15 if you wanted the fuller breakfast), and the selection was a little skimpy; but on the positive side there was a quite capable waitstaff to help you. And there were no washcloths in the room when I arrived, easily fixable but one extra step to get the room in shape for my stay. Despite the minor drawbacks, I would recommend the place. It was a good experience, and I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Day Before New Years' Eve vaca”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl500
Reviews.Content: Marriott gave us a wonderful discount to stay here in December. We decided to enjoy Boston on the Eve of New Year's Eve, 12/30. The hotel is central to the elegant shopping centers on Boylston as well as wonderful restaurants. The Boston Public Library is next door and Copley Square is just a few blocks away. We had a comfortable King bed, the room was clean and nice as was the bath. The parking was surprisingly expensive: $42. We had stayed at The Langham in Boston in November and Friday night parking there was only $28. Wknds vs business nights, y'know. Rooms are not sound proof so bring ear plugs in case you get a noisy family next door. All in all, friendly staff, nice valets and a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TaurusSaurus
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to meeting up with some family for the New Years holiday. It was a great place to hold up for a while. We stayed in a King room and arrived early, thanks to a morning flight. The front desk staff was very helpful and gave us prompt attention, checked us into our room, and gave us a few recommendations for lunch. Our room received a lot of natural light from the huge bay window overlooking the street. The room itself could've been a tad bigger, as the King-bed took up most of it. However, there was a decent closet and drawer space, which could've been used to free up space had we been there more than a night. The bathroom was massive and had a lot of natural light thanks to a floor-to-ceiling window. All the amenities were up to date and very modern and looked to be recently refurbished. The bed was extremely comfortable and we even slept in a bit later than anticipated. Our room had a mini fridge, and a small coffee pot to make coffee/tea in the morning. The location of hte hotel was great, right behind the Boston Public Library, a block or so from Newbury St, and a block from the Copley T station. If its a nice day, the walk down to Boston Public Gardens is very enjoyable and not too long with a lot of shops/restaurants along the way. When we checked out, we had to check our bags with the bellman for a few hours. Service for drop off/pick up was prompt and both attendants were very polite. Would definitely stay here again, its a great value, very comfortable, very modern despite being in a late 1800s building, and close to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: FandE401
Reviews.Content: Stayed on New Years Eve (12/31/11) in a king room booked thru a discount Internet site, very good rate. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions, the room was clean and visually pleasing. Marriott beds are surely the most comfy of hotel beds, and this was no exception. This particular location was great, especially for walking to First Night festivities. Also walking distance to Fenway, where we just had to go to have a drink at Jerry Remy's restaurant. One odd thing about the room, and really the only negative, was the fact that once you turn off the lights from the switches near the door (as in when you're going to bed) it justo happens that one of the switches controls everything...if our get up during the night to use the bathroom, the bathroom light will NOT go on! Not something you can easily figure out at 3 in the morning, that's for sure...and that can't really be a safe way to operate lights! We had some drunk and noisy neighbors that over-enjoyed new years eve. But a call to the front desk addressed that problem, s best as it could. We would certainly stay there again, given a great discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable suites in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TotalTraveller77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 year old right before Christmas. We always try to stay in suites so we have somewhere to go while our son is sleeping. The suite at this hotel was spacious and quiet. I did wish there was a mini-fridge in the room, though. The hotel staff was great. We arrived at 7:00 am after a long redeye flight, and we were able to check into the room immediately. At one point, the battery in our door lock died, and when it took more than 5 minutes to fix, we were given free breakfast vouchers for the next day. Then when our car rental place closed early on Christmas Eve, the front desk helped us try to find a place that was still open and had vehicles available. The location is perfect. Copley Square is just a few T stops from anywhere you want to go downtown. We got week long T passes, so we hopped on even if it was just for one stop. There is also plenty to do within a few block radius of the hotel. We will be back the next time we are in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, clean rooms, and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: dbf78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott twice recently. The service was extremely curteous and helpful, and the rooms were impecably clean. The room was spaceous and everything worked as it's supposed to. I'll definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca P
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, comfortable, quiet, and spacious. Receptionists were helpful and friendly. Can't beat the location. If you are looking for a convenient, clean, and easy place to stay, you will be more than happy with the Courtyard Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for the Pops and Christmas Shopping!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: Great helpful staff who know how to take care of frequent travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem near Copley Square”
Reviews.Author: Travelwriter17751
Reviews.Content: Fifth visit to this Courtyard by Marriott which feels like a boutique hotel. Fabulous location on Exeter Street steps from Copley Plaza. Spacious rooms, good breakfast, wonderful sitting areas downstairs and knowledgeable staff. A winner all round. Should probably be keeping this gem my secret!!

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in Boston for business”
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: After more than a dozen stays, I can confidently recommmend this hotel for business travellers in Boston. The staff is responsive and accommodating of all requests, inlcuding late check outs, baggage storage, directions, and valet service. Rates vary but are generally reasonable. Locatiojn is superb for downtown meetings, shopping, and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 5Continents3toGo
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean friendly typical Courtyard by Marriott. The front desk team is good, and mostly helpful with a good attitude. There is one bellman who also serves as the valet and everything else. He's usually around, but sometimes when he's parking a car, he can disappear for awhile. The rooms have very high ceilings and all the usual amenities. Bathrooms are clean and relatively new. Some of the drawers in the furniture don't work quite right anymore (worn out) and there are some scratches and dings on most of the other furniture - but nothing horrible. The bed was very comfortable. They have a small "pantry" in the lobby where you can buy snacks and beverages. There's also a nice "parlor" lounge off the lobby and a breakfast room that serves each morning. The rooms are configured with the entry doors right off the hallway into the bedroom (as opposed to my preferred way with a hallway between the entry door and the sleeping area - usually with the bathroom and closet in between.) This means that anyone in the hallway can easily wake you up if they're speaking in a regular voice. Fortunately, there are only about 8 or 10 rooms per floor, so hopefully there's not too much traffic. I'd return again some time.

Reviews.Title: “Central location convenient to all”
Reviews.Author: chuckawala
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel in the city, I really liked the location since you can walk to the T, many stores, bars and restaurants. The front desk staff was excellent. You feel like a local when you stay at the this smaller hotel. Check out Thornton's for a budget breakfast a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: And it's right in the heart of Boston too. Check out the Boston Duck Tours right across the street for a great way to see the city! :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: mlomagno
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location near all. Shaw supermarket is open 24/7, great for getting snacks or wine. Did not have breakfast in the hotel but there is starbucks as well as Au bon pain within a block of hotel. Check in was fast and friendly. Room was a decent size, bed and pillows very comfortable. Bathroom spacious. Wireless Internet was fantastic. No lost signals and very fast. Negatives: Room was dusty and was not vacuumed properly. There was debris on the rug that was easily spotted to the eye and shelves that one can write things in a layer of dust. Not good. However, the room was clean. The manager of housekeeping needs to be more on the ball. I would definitely stay here again withour reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Easy, Comfortable and Super Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Rif_L
Reviews.Content: I didn't really know anything about this hotel before I arrived. I just picked it because of its convenient location and reasonable rates. Let me say i was more then impressed. I have never stayed at a hotel where the manager (Ben was his name I believe) knows your name. I have stayed in many courtyards before but this something above and beyond. I was was taken a back with how much the entire staff actually cared about your comfort and well being. From the valet (thanks woogie) to the manager it was an experience beyond the traditional "check-in and check-out" they made it easy for me to be comfortable and I was grateful for it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Roving2
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay! This "boutique" hotel was beautifully appointed in muted tones. Very comfortable beds too! The staff was not only friendly but always helpful, be it finding a restaurant, toting bags or fetching things from the car (valet parking). Would definitely return. Ben is great! Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Class”
Reviews.Author: Kathy W
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler and stay in Boston every week. I found this hotel after trying many and can now call it my home away from home. The service is the best I have experienced in all areas from front desk to valet. They have an onsite sales gentleman Ben Dodge who is outstanding and will make every effort to accomodate all of your needs. The GM Bernardo is out and about and knows all of the guests and makes sure you have everything to make your stay as comfortable as possible. In addition to the service the rooms are very nice and have a comfortable chair to relax in and nice working area. The breakfast has alot of variety with hot and cold items. The location is perfect for those who wnat to be close to the action of Copley Square, Boylston St., Newbury St and much more. By far this hotel meets all of my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: baalh
Reviews.Content: Fine room, very clean, helpful staff, good fitness center (can even do laps in the pool, albeit short ones), unbeatable location, especially for upscale Copley Place mall. Nearby T stops (Copley or Back Bay).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TomR45
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Copley Square has a great location, comfortable clean rooms and was a good value. The staff was very friendly, accommodating and professional.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet cozy treasure in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: Lauren V
Reviews.Content: I use to live in Boston and recently have stayed here three times and each time have absolutely found this hotel to be a treasure; small, quiet, cozy, and a fantastic location to my favorite Newbury street shops (Cotelac) and restaurants (Sonsie). The staff is beyond gracious, welcoming, accommodating and knowledgeable. Not fancy, but updated, clean, convenient, and comfortable. A five Star value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: KOB16
Reviews.Content: We pricelined the room on a Friday night and were given a nice room on a high floor, bed was comfortable, room was clean, bathrooms are small but not a big dea for us, location perfect for seeing show at the Wang Theatre, and staff very polite. Check in was very quick too which was good b/c we were in a hurry to get to dinner. We took a cab to Newbury Street and it only cost 9.00 and took about 10 min with traffic.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: stiev a
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great location and you can visit all around the city. The staff was nice and was helpfull when we needed advise. We did not stay for long - only 2 days , but we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hpertel
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this convenient hotel. The rooms were clean, nice, and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: ALreporting
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife for 5 days as part of a three week retirement holiday in New England. An excellent hotel with a great location. Walk across the road and through the carpark to enter the massive Prudential shopping centre which also includes several restaurants. You'll also find a supermarket when you go through this car park. You are within walking distances of many Boston attractions and the hotel is close to a subway station. We were staying in Boston for 5 days and found the 15$ 7 day subway ticket great value. A clean hotel with friendly staff. There is no restaurant in the hotel for evening meals but there are many restaurants within walking distance. We did not have breakfast in the hotel so cannot comment on that. There are many options for a sandwich and coffee nearby. Paneras are great. Free wi fi in the hotel was free and fast. We were able to skype easily from the room and avoid expensive transatlantic phone calls. A relaxed atmosphere in the hotel. There was beer tasting and massage in the lounge one evening. The beer was free but there is a charge for the massage. I enjoyed both while my wife surfed the net on the computer. No complaints about this hotel. We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: bobbertusa
Reviews.Content: Geat location, hotel, and staff. Not a typical Courtyard, but more like a small boutique hotel without all the frills. Lots of shopping, restaurants, sightseeing close by. Would not stay anyplace else on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: James G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on our recent trip to Boston. We could not have asked for a better location. We were only one block from Newberry Street which has a lot of nice shops and great restaurants. And, only about two blocks from Copley Place Mall. That has a lot of places to eat and some great stores, - such as Neiman Marcus. We took two Grey Line tours, and were able to be picked up at the big Marriott Hotel at Copley Place. So, it was very convenient, because the bus picked us up there, and brought us back to the Marriott Copley Place. Our Marriott Courtyard was only a short walk from Marriott Copley Place. And we preferred staying at the Courtyard because it was a much smaller hotel, with only about 80 rooms. The people at the front desk could not have been any nicer to us, and the general manager there, whose name is Ben, went out of his way to make us feel welcome. The rooms were very nicely furnished. If we go back to Boston some time, I would definetly want to stay at this hotel again. And, I would certainly recommend this place to my friends. And, if you are a baseball fan, please take the time to take a tour of Fenway Park. It was about a 40 minute tour, and the tour guides are really great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: GZOOOM
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers good comfortable accommodation for central Boston. The staff are friendly, attentive, very helpful and efficient. The rooms and beds are fine but the decor in the reception and hallways of the hotel is tired and needs a refresh. Out front of the hotel it looks quite poor but overall it offers good value in a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect-the only place in Boston I want to stay :-)”
Reviews.Author: Walt T
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, a real pearl. The front-desk ladies, Lillie & Katey, went out of their way to assist me in checking in & made sure I felt welcome. The room was super-clean (as always), the view of Boston was beautiful (I was on the 9th floor), and the General Manager Mr Bernardo Gubert makes everyone feel right at home. Not only was my room just the best, but the way you are treated here by staff will stick in your mind a long time :-) (P.S. - the breakfast is delicious, and you're right around the corner from the T station).

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: Lori12309
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a hotel this is. It has only 81 rooms and absolutely NO corporate vibe about it. Itâ€™s actually very boutique-y, with wonderful public rooms. The location is within walking distance of lots of great Boston attractions, as well as the T (subway). My room (301) was ready at 12:30--two-and-a-half hours before the official check-in time and I was very pleased. Although small and lacking a view, it was immaculate and ergonomically perfect. Absolutely everything a guest could require in Boston was providedâ€”the bed was extremely comfortable and I seriously considered trying to purloin a pillow. The bathroom was sparkling clean and equipped with sufficient towels and complimentary toiletries. (I had forgotten my toothbrush and toothpaste and the doll at the front desk cheerfully handed over both.) There is no street noise to speak of, and the climate controls were excellent. Upon check-in, guests are given a code for access to free WI-FI, and there was a computer and printer available in the lobby. Even the elevators are speedy. In the morning, guests may avail themselves of free coffee, tea and newspapers in the lounge. There is a restaurant which serves breakfast and a fitness center which I regrettably had no time to use. There is valet parking, but I parked in the garage across the street instead, and saved a whopping couple of bucks. The staff was brilliantâ€”courteous, professional, warm and friendly. Next time I have occasion to visit Boston, I will certainly make a reservation here.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jdg1jazz
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago we decided to stay over for the weekend at the the Marriott Copley Square Courtyard in part to see a Sox game at Fenway ( they lost!). This was our second time staying at this hotel. Both times the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but well appointed and comfortable with a unique layout reminiscent of a European boutique hotel. The location is also superb for seeing and getting around Boston either by foot or on the T. The only downside is with the cost of parking which is not their fault. Would have appreciated some discount for either parking or breakfast as long standing Marriott Reward members. Otherwise highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “For what it is, amazingâ€”very surprised”
Reviews.Author: sologirltraveler
Reviews.Content: While I generally prefer more upscale hotels, I was in Boston for a 5-day business trip and saw the great reviews on here, so I thought I'd give it a try. I have to say the service was better than I've received at some much fancier hotels! From the moment I checked in to anything I needed from the front desk (extra toothpaste) to grabbing some wine from the self-service bar downstairs, it felt like a little home away from home. I do appreciate they had a doorman who ran down all the way to Boylston St. to grab me a cab more than once. (Remember to tip a few bucks for this--these guys surely earn it!) I also appreciated I sent a 2-page fax at no charge, and also one morning I grabbed a free coffee from the lobby and asked for soymilk (I'm allergic to dairy) and one of the guys from the kitchen ran to the store to get it for me! And there was one day I was on conference calls nearly every hour except for two, leaving only two hours for them to turn around my room. I asked them to when I went out for lunch, and when I returned it was complete. The building is a gorgeous old restored apartment building. Just keep in mind this is a Courtyard so the beds are not great, but I asked for more blankets and they quickly brought me two. The fitness center is kind of a joke--it's super tiny and has only three machines, but better than nothing. I opted instead to run down to the Charles River, which is only a 5-minute jog away. I love that their rooms are set up for business, including extra desk space and TONS of outlets (hooray!) and FREE WIRELESS INTERNET; what a nice change. The breakfast buffet looked pretty decent but I didn't have a chance to try it. The location is super -- right in the middle of everything; near shopping, tons of restaurants, and all Back Bay has to offer. I had such a great experience here that I'll be staying here again, and likely having my employees stay here too on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: DrBeekman
Reviews.Content: Traveling to downtown Boston for the first time. Had made a updated online reservation with another hotel who lost the new reservation and we were forced to find another place to stay. The original hotel recommended the Courtyard by Mariott. The Courtyard's price was over $100 less and the rooms were a nice. The only problem that I noticed was that the water pressure in our room was extremly low. Otherwise, I would recommend this hotel over more expensive hotels in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service leads to excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Johnmmcgrath
Reviews.Content: One of the best cared for of the courtyard properties. The front desk was excellent in every way. Thanks for the great stay. This is a great hotel if you want a major brand in a great place, but you want more of a specialty hotel feel.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location for less $$$$”
Reviews.Author: Wtravel66
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean, well thought through amenities, comfy bed, friendly staff. Right next door to Lenox and Copley Square hotels, but the room was about $140 cheaper. I stayed previously at both of these and don't see what the extra money is for. Will stay at Cortyard again with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “They make me feel at home....”
Reviews.Author: Kermitt W
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this very neat, very hospitable and very well located hotel for some years now. And I will keep coming back. Mr. Gubert and his staff really take hospitality to the highest level. My compliments to all of them. They make me feel like a long lost friend. I'll be back!!!!!!!! Being walking distance to some of the finest restaurants in Boston is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen M
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed here and both times have been wonderful. I'm a former road warrior, so my standards are pretty high, and this Courtyard more than meets it. The rooms are recently renovated, the beds are comfortable, the central location is fantastic, and the staff could not be more pleasant. It's the little things that make your stay nice, and this time it was arriving after a 2+ hour flight delay and having a plate of chocolate chip cookies waiting at the front desk. Thanks for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Copley Courtyard in the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: CAMark746
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Rooms are a little tight with the feel of a smaller boutique style hotel near Fenway (10 blocks), shopping on Newbury Street, the T and quite walkable to the historic sites downtown. Bernardo, the GM, goes out of his way to make his guests feel at home. Whatever he can do to make your stay easier will be at the top of his list...

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: lysah88
Reviews.Content: I had the hardest time finding a nice affordable hotel in Boston during the first week of September with everyone going back to Universities. I landed upon this Courtyard and it was so nice! I'm very verrrrrryyyy picky about cleanliness and our room was perfectly clean and fresh. -Location can't be beat,right next to Newbury street, Copley etc. -Very CLEAN! -Friendly, nice, attentive front deak -Great size for its location -Great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location for tourist”
Reviews.Author: junyea
Reviews.Content: Loved the location! Walking distance to restuarants (Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen), and to plenty of shops. Rights around the corner from the Boston Library, and the Touristy Duck Tours (must take tours). This place also had alot of traffic, which made it easy to catch a cab to further places. There is an entrance to the subway about a block away. Also very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, and Staff was Tremendous”
Reviews.Author: Brian J
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely one of the best hotels in Boston for the location for all our needs. The shopping, train to Fenway Park, and the "Duck Boat Tour" take off point were all only two blocks away. Our room was clean and staff was friendly. My son and I had a great "Get Away".

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Brian D
Reviews.Content: During our stay we had many special requests. We were provided with prompt, courteous, professional service every time. We will definitely stay here again the next time we're in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, cleam”
Reviews.Author: SearchLite99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel along with another family member in a second room. Both rooms were clean and modern. The location is around the corner from the Copley Square subway stop and across the street from the Boston Public Library. The library is worth a visit if you are in the area as it has old world elegance and incredible architecture. This hotel has the charm of a European boutique hotel. It used to be an elegant Copley Square apartment building that was converted to a hotel around 2003. It is not your average Courtyard. Service at both the front desk and restaurant are first class. The morning breakfast is very good although no other meals are served at the location. The breakfast options include a buffet with many options or made to order omelets, french toast or hot cakes. Servers keep things clean and moving. Parking is technically valet only however there is a public garage across the street that is extremely convenient. If you go to the Boston Parking Authority web site, you can find discount parking coupons that will reduce the 24 hour rate from about $40 to $25. The garage is listed as the Prudential parking garage. One other thing that I always look for in hotel rooms... quiet HVAC systems that do the job quickly. This one passed the test.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Frank W
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience and amazing staff, only problem was the small rooms and limited amount of space to move around. Hotel itself was up kept and clean.

Reviews.Title: “they were so gracious”
Reviews.Author: lisaprn1
Reviews.Content: After my room was given away by the Lenox Hotel at 12:30 AM., the Marriot Courtyard graciously accept me at 1:30 AM. I was also given a complimentary breakfast. Of course the Lenox Hotel paid the bill, since they gave my pre- paid room away to another guest. The Courtyard Hotel was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. I was given a suite. They boasted that their hotel was small, about 80 rooms, and very quiet. They were totally correct. "The Hotel tone was that of a comfortable home where you were welcomed. My room was more suited for a businessman. It was decorated in sailboats, which I do own one, but had a more masculine and/or business tone to this suite. Again, The staff was wonderful, keeping my bags for me the next day so I could run the city. They went out of their way to make sure that the rest of my stay was not tainted by what the Lenox Hotel had done. I want to thank them very much for their gracious hospitality. I highly recommend this hotel. Oh by the way, the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Ed M
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was extremely courteous and responsive to our needs. We needed extra towels and facecloths and called the desk, within 10 minutes the housekeeping staff was at our room with the linens we requested. We have stayed at this hotel several times and each time we have had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Justine L
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, but not worth the price. Rms. small & water temp. a problem & noone seemed to care. Walls too thin. Noise next door 'til 2AM. Front desk very courteous. It's Boston so guess you can get away with these prices. Valet parking a rip off price. With tipping eveyone not worth it

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay during Hurricane Irene!”
Reviews.Author: nwlilac
Reviews.Content: We planned this trip well before there was any threat of the storm. We knew this location would be convenient for us (restaurants, Fenway), at a decent price. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. I think it is a rehab-ed older building, so the smaller windows and sometimes noticeably thin walls make a little more sense when you know that. We booked an extra night at the beginning of our stay (since our flight at the end of the weekend was likely to be canceled) and they made that quite easy for us, and kept is in the same room. Since we ended up spending more time in the hotel than we had previously anticipated... we can say that both the service and communication from the hotel about the storm were very good. The in-house breakfast a necessity for us, but it was good. It was also helpful that there is a mini-fridge in the room and a microwave downstairs. Since we couldnâ€™t go out on Sunday, we could keep leftovers from the previous night. There is also a Shawâ€™s right across the street, so we could buy snacks and drinks. It was a nice place to ride out the storm!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - we highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cms575
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for three nights during a vacation. Although we arrived well before check-in time we were immediately given a room. The room was well-equipped and reasonable in size and the room and hotel were very clean. The staff at this hotel are top notch - everyone was pleasant and helpful and they gave us great information as we had never visited Boston before. We particularly found the restaurant suggestions helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent, close to shopping, many great restaurants and within easy walking distance of many of the city's historic sights. We enjoyed the breakfast at the hotel on two mornings and found the food fresh and plentiful and the service good. We would definitely stay here again and we also recommend this hotel as a great choice for other travellers to Boston - great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was superb!”
Reviews.Author: sandyvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Copley as we were touring several colleges in the Boston area. Their location is excellent, they guided us on great restaurants, the local tranportation system and we used a cost effective town car sytem that they help coordinate for us! They were fantastic and our trip ran smoothly and efficiently and they were professional and congenial!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and experience!”
Reviews.Author: fred P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in Boston-Copley Place, near the Duck Boat Tours and Shopping. Everyone at the hotel was friendly, from the bellhop that took my bag from the cab to the front desk. The rooms are modern and like the building architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: tom1277
Reviews.Content: This was a good location. The staff was so very helpful they just went out of the way to make sure a stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “clean, safe and lovely location.”
Reviews.Author: dawn5851
Reviews.Content: The easiest way to find this hotel is that it is next to the Boston Public Library and the big Prudential Center. I really have nothing negative to say. Great location, two blocks from Newberry street which is a nice safe brownstone area, restaurants and shopping district. There is no bar here but tons of places nearby including nextdoor. You can buy beer and wine until 11pm in the lobby store. The rooms are quiet even though in a fairly busy area. I found the room to be spacious, super clean, comphy beds and pillows, hubby found the desk and internet fine for business. The only odd thing i found was that the rooms have no in room safe? I hope this is read by somebody with Marriott because we find it almost a must in these times with passports, wallets and cellphones that you dont always lug around with you while you site see. Bring walking shoes and you dont need a car if you enjoy walking. You may park your own car down the street at the garage, which is slightly cheaper and you can access your vehicle more often. Valet serviceis also provided for $40 perday. I love walking and toured Boston by myself (43yr old woman) and felt safe, roads easy to navigate and it is about 1 mile down to the Commons, where the Freedom Trail begins. I suggest Trident Bookstore for Breakfast, down Newberry about 6 blocks....also a super Tapas place on newberry about 3 blocks down to the left. I would absolutly stay here again, loved being a bit out of downtown, but lots to do and see in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - mall is connected”
Reviews.Author: amylee87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is connected to a great mall for shopping around. Also nice walking area and close to lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Pete B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this room two weeks prior to our trip out east. We heard that this hotel was a great place to stay and they were correct. We were greeted by Raphael (valet) who was more than willing to not only take our numerous bags to our room, but quickly informed us that he would assist us in any way to make our stay special. After we valeted our vehicle we changed and came down stairs for a reception at the front desk hosted by the General manager and sales manger. They were so easy to talk to and it was evident that they wanted the best for their guests. They helped us find a place to eat dinner and a place for dessert. Our check out the next morning was seamless and the breakfast was really good. Everyone at the hotel so nice to us that it was kind of spooky, they were nicer than family! Tell Bernardo that Pete from Michigan sent you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mcf3juw
Reviews.Content: Didn't know about this place until I arrived in Boston- Switched hotels mid-conference to this place and it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location, AWESOME staff!!”
Reviews.Author: rhonem
Reviews.Content: Place was very nice and Justin and Sam were awesome. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, awesome location, boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RMA626
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Copley Square is a fantastic find. This was my first stay and Iâ€™ll definitely return. This is a boutique hotel and a nice change from the corporate behemoth across the street. The property is also a nice change from the usual Courtyard â€œfeelâ€� because itâ€™s not standard in any way. I was pleased that my room did not have the standard under the window Courtyard air-conditioning unit that blows too hard. The Courtyard Copley Square has the air-conditioning in ducts that are above head, which kept the room comfortable. I liked that I could open the windows about three inches, which allowed for fresh air to come into the room. My room faced another building, which provided additional quiet and privacy. The room was very quiet for the three days of my stay. Other reviews note the advantageous location. I walked pretty much everywhere I needed to go, including over to Cambridge for appointments. When I wanted to take the T, I walked a few blocks to Copley Station. Added conveniences include a nearby Shawâ€™s supermarket, where I bought fresh foods, two drugstores, and many area restaurants. One night I met friends for a pint at the Irish pub around the corner where we sat at a table on the sidewalk. Many reviewers complain about the size of the rooms. The rooms are small compared to most hotels in the U.S. I consider my room on the 7th floor to be standard for European hotels, and many hotels in New York City. However, I was comfortable as a single person. I imagine that it would be a tight fit for a couple. The workspace was really nice and well lit. My room came with a comically over-sized flat-screen television. It was like being in a screening room, when compared to the size of the room. There are drawbacks that are not deal-breakers, but worth noting. The lighting in my room did not extend to the entry, which is where the thermostat for the air-conditioning is located. Since I donâ€™t travel with a flashlight, I had to use my cell phone to shine light on the thermostat in order to manage room temperature. The big annoyance was the Internet speed. Internet is included in the room rate, but it was painfully slow. At times, plugging directly to Ethernet worked better than wireless. That was not, however, always the case. Iâ€™m not a heavy data user, but even simple browser tasks just wouldnâ€™t work at particular times. One other annoyance was that the advertised room rate that I book included â€œbreakfast for two.â€� However, when I got my breakfast certificates they were â€œbreakfast for one.â€� The problem was that, based on the advertised rate, I invited a business colleague to meet me for breakfast. Instead of fighting it, I made alternate plans elsewhere. This hotel keeps a coffee and tea station in the lobby only in the morning. Most Courtyards have coffee and tea available throughout the day, which is a nice feature. I heard other guests asking about that on my first afternoon at the hotel. The desk agent referred the guest to the packet in his room. It would seem that providing coffee throughout the day would be a convenience that the hotel management would see as valuable to business customers. Iâ€™m surprised that this feature has been overlooked. Most of the desk staff people were warm and inviting. The restaurant staff were particularly friendly and warm. Staff were readily accessible and easy to find because the hotel is small. I arrived very late so I called ahead from a connecting airport. Information on my arrival was properly relayed to the person attending the desk and I was expected when I arrived. That was a nice touch after a long day of connecting travel from the west coast. I chose to stay at the Courtyard Copley Square because of the favorable rate I got on Marriottâ€™s website. Iâ€™ll look forward to staying here again on future trips to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelerOlney
Reviews.Content: If you drive in, as we did keep, a good look out for the hotel as it has a small footprint and entrance is streetside. A very cordial staff. Room was on the small side but no surprise based on a city location, and the hotel was in a great location. We were within walking distance of tons of places to visit and eat at and near multiple subway stations. Great value in a central location with a very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Volvodadfast
Reviews.Content: The suite was spacious enough for 3 adults and an older child. While there was usual A/C noise level in the sitting room, the bedroom was silent. Staff was friendly and helpful. Facility was clean and well maintained. Only things I can think to recommend are upgrading the exercise room and discounts for overnight parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maggiemay7
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Courtyard hotel - clean, comfortable bed, small room. The location is terrific - right near the mall and several blocks to the Commons & Newbury St. The best part of this particular Marriott Courtyard is their staff. From the front desk to the valet, everyone was friendly, helpful and professional; compliments to housekeeping as well. My only suggestion is to switch out the pulsating shower head, which doesn't work & just shoots water all over (what's with Marriott & their bad showerheads?) and replace it with a rain showerhead instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Quaint, cozy and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: NinaSorren1974
Reviews.Content: Began with Raphael the most friendly, professional and accommodating doorman/valet I've met. Rooms were very clean. My family had the 2 double beds which was decent in size for a city hotel, our travelling companions had a king which was quite small. Love the Copley area, lots of amazing restaurants in area and cleaner and more attractive then the historic area. Front desk/concierge was very helpful and patient in answering all my questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: laslist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copley Square for a wedding. The room was super. Loved the location as it is convenient to most everything. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We look forward to returning!”
Reviews.Author: gviggiano
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Courtyard. The rooms were extremely clean and the staff was fantastic! We took the Boston Hon-on Hop-off Trolley Tour and had a blast touring around Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location small rooms but cozy”
Reviews.Author: mskrisanda
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in a great part of downtown Boston. Walking distance to Fenway. Rooms are small but functional. This Marriott doesn't give free breakfast to gold members (only platinum). Also parking is $42/day across the street. The price you pay for the location I guess!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but Worth It”
Reviews.Author: BRuthNic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 12 year old nephew for two days. We were going to Fenway Park for the Red Sox game and the hotel is only $7 cab ride away. The room we had was spacious and perfectly clean. The staff were very professional. The breakfast buffet was over-priced for the quality and kind of food they were offering. The pool was a bit over-chlorinated, but at least it was clean. We got the room for almost half off on Priceline. I wouldn't have paid the full rate, but for half off, it felt like we had won a lottery. A great place to stay to treat yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Baltotrav2
Reviews.Content: Were in Boston with hubby and son for son's orientation at Boston University. The Courtyard Copley Square is a bit cheaper and on a much quieter street than the Marriott which is a block away . Check in was a breeze, everyone working at the desk were great. We were in room 909 which had a living area with sleep sofa (we opted for a large cot as opposed to small, which is available on a first come first serve basis but decidedly more comfortable than sofa), coffee table, fridge and a couple of chairs and a TV that could be closed off with a door from the bedroom which contained two queen beds, large desk area and a comfortable chair. Bathroom was adequate and clean. the view was across some rooftop gardens which was pleasant and the street was quiet. Our stay was 2 nights and on the first there was a free Sam Adams beer tasting with cheese and crackers in the lobby. Nice touch. Our breakfast was not included. If you choose the Courtyard and need a cot, request it when you reserve and mention it again when you check in. We will be staying here again for family weekend in October.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN A VERY NICE SECTION OF THE CITY.”
Reviews.Author: ken1saunders
Reviews.Content: Great area of boston to stay in, within walking distance to all of the areas activities.

Reviews.Title: “First time- but not last time- gues”
Reviews.Author: rroger
Reviews.Content: Needed to be within walking distance of my office and the Sheraton, where they usually put me, was just a tad too far with what I had to carry. THis hotel turned out to be more than I expected! My room was quite spacious considering I was in the heart of Boston! Front desk staff was always pleasant and the night i got in there was a Samuel Adams tasting so I even had a cold one to ward off the heat of summer! I hope I get sent back to visit the office again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: LRBART
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Boston to see a Red Sox game and to sightsee. Hotel was in a great location for shopping, eating and jumping on the subway. Was able to walk to Fenway and many resturants. Staff were very helpful and polite. As an added bonus was able to get government discount rate which made it very reasonable compared to other hotels in the same area. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere2ce
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fine for a business or adult guest, but definitely not for a family or for heavy tourism. There is no pool, and it really did not feel very 'family friendly.' It is still within walking distance to the typical Boston sites, but it's a longer walk. The rooms are very small, but clean. The front desk personnel were often too busy talking among themselves to tend to the guests (at one point there were two waiting). There is no airport transportation, so we had to wait about half an hour for a cab. My travel agent had called ahead and ordered some extra amenities to be delivered to our room, but they never arrived - although her credit card had been charged. If you are in Boston for business, this would be fine, but if your plans are to explore Boston, I would suggest a hotel over on the wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Very average with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: tedpollard
Reviews.Content: A very average hotel for the price, and relative to the Marriott down the street. I am a Platinum member and they treated me like a second class citizen. Thank goodness I used reward points. I would NEVER pay money to stay here. PS, their fitness center is pathetic: 2 treadmills and a broken stationary bike. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Marriott on Huntington. Much nicer rooms and more amenities like a pool and lots of fitness equipment. Ask for a high floor facing Huntington ave for a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Celliot
Reviews.Content: Came with the family for a few nights. Room was wonderful! breakfast service excellent. Nice young lady serving gave us tons of information. The location is also AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Just What I Needed”
Reviews.Author: mikealeon
Reviews.Content: Being rushed on back to back business trips and problems in travel arrangements caused stressed. On my second trip, the Courtyard Marriot caught me by surprise! It's just not your typical modern state of the art hotel. The outside reflects the subtle charms of Boston with its old style brick decour. I walked into courteous staff and by chance, a Boston Lager representative with free samples! The room was pristine with windows pouring in light and the room temperature perfect. Sinking into soft pillows and the comfortable bed lulled me to sleep. Not knowing the area, the front desk staff were the perfect concierce providing places to see and experience. It's a Boston experience you want to bring the family to enjoy in it's quaint and charming setting, without the large crowds flowing in an out of hotels, but yet be directly in the center of the city! Definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Whenever We Are in Boston”
Reviews.Author: MarieLondon93
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. The location is wonderful: close to shopping at the Prudential Center and Copley Place, a block from the subway, a block from Copley Square, just across the street from the beautiful Boston public library, but still on a pretty quiet 2-lane street. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Our room was quiet and very clean. My son had a very comfortable roll-away bed. The breakfast are was pleasant, and the quality and selection of food was quite good. Views are limited, but we requested (and got) a room on an upper floor - from our room we could see MIT. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lab804
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while in town for our son's graduation. The Copley T-stop was just around the corner and it was an easy trip over to MIT. There are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance plus a Shaw's grocery store. We like to eat a light breakfast of yogurt and fruit in our room so the grocery and the room refrigerator made that easy to do. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The usual room rate had been increased to take advantage of all the families in town for graduation so we paid more than we normally would for this type of room/hotel. All of the hotels raise their rates during the many graduation weekends in Boston. The hotel does not have a pool or a workout room.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and will definitely be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mzrzmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week and everything was perfect. The room was spacious and quiet. The location was superb...Back Bay, Newbury Street, Copley Square shopping, Fenway Park etc..all within walking distance. Thank you to the very friendly and kind valet. He was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst Courtyards, IMO...overpriced, worn, smelly”
Reviews.Author: India_Pia
Reviews.Content: OK- so I am pretty loyal to Marriott due to their rewards program, but I won't stay at this Marriott on my next trip to Boston. Marriott really let me down!! As others have mentioned, here were my issues: 1-Room was really overpriced and I had to stay due to business colleagues staying there or I would have gone to the CharlesMark and been done with it due to high rates at hotels in Boston. Really, really overpriced for the room I got. 2-Room was really bad. It stank, opening window didn't help - determined that smell was coming from bed/pillows. UGH. Mattress of bed sagged on left side when you sat on it. Room was also somewhat worn in a lot of places and therefore looked suspiciously unclean 3-Hotel halls and entry are really "corporate" and ugly looking. It's a historical building that they shoehorned a Marriott into On the other hand, the location is great-walking distance to shopping and restaurants. My recommendations: look at the Hilton or Lenox nearby...or the Charles Mark. All better rooms than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Artsy3003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Marriott last weekend and we were incredibly pleased with the hotel. The location is perfect, right in walking distance to restaurants, bars, etc. We even walking to Fenway Park which only took 15-20 minutes. When we arrived we reserved a double room for four people and they upgraded us to a suite at no charge because they were limited on the double rooms available. The suite was AMAZING! During out stay we asked for extra towels, pillows, roll a way beds etc. and the service was the quickest and best I have ever experienced. We booked through Expedia and it included complementary breakfast which was a very high end breakfast. Tons of hot foods, cold foods, fruit, egg station, you name it. Every employee there seems pleasant and the only negative thing was that the elevators were really slow. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Job!”
Reviews.Author: Passionforitall
Reviews.Content: Flew into Boston for a quick overnight visit from NY to catch a Red Sox game with my boys. It had been quite sometime since I had been to Boston so my approach was to find a nice hotel with favorable rates located somewhere near the stadium. Mission accomplished! Our room was spacious and comfortable, the employees were friendly and helpful and location, location, location! Fabulous restaurants and shopping abounded which only added to our great day of play in Boston! Bob from New York I travel frequently for both business and pleasure and have been in the hospitality industry for 30 plus years. I will tell you that this hotel fit the bill! Highly reccomended from someone who knows!

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay at the Marriott Courtyard Copley Square and would return in the future”
Reviews.Author: chloe31350
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Courtyard by Marriott Boston Copley Square for two nights (June2011.) The location of the hotel was excellent, the room was spacious and clean and the hotel personnel were helpful and pleasant. The rate for this great Boston location was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service...”
Reviews.Author: ktst66
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Copley Square for 5 nights in late May. We were extremely impressed with this hotel. All of the staff have were excellent and there is definitely a customer-focused culture that is impressive. The location is great and we are sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, friendly staff, loved it”
Reviews.Author: KEH65
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT central location, right around the corner from the Copley T stop, great Back Bay location close to wide variety of shops, restaurants from cheap eats to super chic, and easy subway access to everything else. Cannot say enough about the wonderful staff at this location. Breakfast was good, too, if you get it included. Rooms also had a refrigerator, which was great for saving a little $$ on meals.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: genebeans
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my grandson and the front desk was extremely helpful in getting us a driver and other reservations.The hotel room was very clean and everything worked in the room. We took the breakgfast package which isI would suggest to all as it is decent. Great location for walking and getting the Duck tour and Fenway etc. Plenty of restaurants nearby

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: CheshireGrandad
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel and again we were not disappointed.The hotel is a medium size and has a comfortable atmosphere. The service is excellent and friendly. Tucked away in a quiet side street next to the Boston Public Library, the location is ideal for all amenities being within a short walk to shopping malls, subway stations, restaurants and bars and Boston Common and Public Gardens. We had requested and were allocated a high floor for better views over Boston. The only disappointment was that the bedroom furniture was somewhat dated, with badly fitting drawers and cupboard doors - not a major issue and did not affect our enjoyment of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariaLouisa
Reviews.Content: Spent few nights in this hotel with my husband 8th may onwards, all I can say is that this hotel was excellent, rooms so clean and roomy, excellent cleaning services with bottle of water in room available for purchase. Champions Bar was good for food & drink and great atmosphere. Located in the Shopping Centre linking to Prudential Centre. Favourtie hotel in Boston and located to the best restaurant in Boston, Cheesecake Factory. I'll be back to this hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden "gem". location and staff, enough said.”
Reviews.Author: Busiestbeebee
Reviews.Content: Frequently travel to Boston for work. Prior to my recent two night stay, I had never used this hotel. Moving forward- I'll only stay here. Location- perfect nook right in the heart of the city. So surprised at proximity to just about everything Boston has to offer. Staff- They don't make them like this anymore Added bonus: complimentary beer (good beer!), upon returning from a long work day. It's the little touches as such that put it in my category of a "gem".

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: 4ontheroadMD
Reviews.Content: It's nothing extravagant but this is a fine hotel - clean, comfortable, good staff. And it's in a good location, near the T and Copley Square. And it was cheaper than many options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: tmcct
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Courtyard Boston Copley Square was very enjoyable from the moment we arrived. We received a friendly greeting from the valet who parked our car, were welcomed at check-in by a courteous and efficient front desk agent, and enjoyed the comfort of a clean, spacious, and nicely designed guestroom. The hotel is convenient to shopping, restaurants, and late night entertainment and is within easy walking distance to Fenway Park. We appreciated the friendliness of the staff and their genuine desire to provide helpful information and services that made our stay in Boston all the more pleasant and hassle-free. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for clean, comfortable, convenient accommodations in the Copley Square area of Boston with a staff that aims to please.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dkbpc
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a great location, near restaurants, shopping and subway system. Staff was very acommodating, even went down the street to purchase a New York Times for me. Boston hotels are all expensive, but this one was well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Boston -the right price and the right people.”
Reviews.Author: jwheatley
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Boston for business. When booking my hotel, I never look anywhere else. The hotel location is fantastic. Just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Newbury street to have a relaxing stay. The facilities are great, the rooms are always clean and comfortable, but the real reason is the staff. After 6 months of every other week visits I got to know most of them by first name and they knew me. This means a lot as a business traveler away from home all too frequently. They were always very welcoming and always willing to go the extra mile to make your stay exactly what you need while you are away. I have consistently recommended this hotel to others and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: bigoldog
Reviews.Content: It is our third time staying at this hotel ,.It has become our home while we are here for the marathon . It is nice to walk into a hotel and the front desk remembers your name after a year . The staff here has always treated me like family . They go out of their way to accomdate you . Even one the staff in the lobby went out of his way almost got smucked by a car trying to hail a cab . The rooms are always clean and cozy .We use the queen suites .They have a great front lobby and chilling area , with a computer and nice big chairs to snuggle into . I highly recommend staying at this hotel for either business or pleasure it is close to almost everything . .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for Marathon”
Reviews.Author: mini6s
Reviews.Content: Clean, small, and quiet, this Marriott is tucked away on Exeter St, just around the corner from the Copley Square finish line for the Boston Marathon. Amazingly, rooms were still available for that weekend only a month before the event. Breakfast service included a good variety of hot and cold items, all fresh and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: MaineMikey
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find I had mistakenly booked another Marriott hotel and also didn't have my cocnfirmation number with me, but had my Marriott Rewards card. The desk manager was wonderful. He tracked down my reservation, cancelled it and provided a lovely room at the same price of my original reservation. He was pleasant, smiling and welcoming the whole time. It's a great location for walking and shopping. My sister and I attended the Boston Ballet before checking in and took in the Chihully Exhibit at the Museum of Fine Arts the next day. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was convenient and a good value for the selections offered. Overnight parking is pricey at $42.00 and the vallet informed me of the cost on arrival. Convenience is worth the price. Other oprions might be less but not by much. It is Boston!

Reviews.Title: “If the price is right, a very convenient location for Boston Travel”
Reviews.Author: dcv2002
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel for 4 nights for the Boston Marathon. Fri-Tues. I lucked out and got a very good deal on this hotel with breakfast. We were able to check-in right away at 1pm. The room was on the top floor, rather large (we got the handicap room). Room was clean, no problems. Your typical Courtyard hotel. They even provided two bottles of Gatorade for the marathon weekend. The free breakfast would not be worth actually paying for it. It provided us a free meal at breakfast that was it. Close to Prudential Mall, Shaws and the Copley T, and Back Bay Amtrak.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Hynes Convention Ctr. and shopping, but no free wifi”
Reviews.Author: blueskyblueocean
