Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff, connected by enclosed arcades to other hotels, shopping, and the Hynes Convention Center so you don't need outerwear to go to those places, cabs at curbside 24 hrs, room is basic but very nice and clean, bed was one of the best I've slept on in a hotel (could also be that I was exhausted after conferences too), and shower and hot water was great. Cons: No free wifi or convenient computer access, no convenient breakfast place, my room had thin walls so I could clearly hear the conversations of the 3 men next door, my room was on the Huntington Street side near the busy intersection and I could hear the cabs honking their horns throughout the early evening, and the lobby area was constantly crowded. This turned out great for business and is very convenient to Newbury Street shopping and many restaurants. Access to transit is a couple of blocks away. i would definitely stay here again, choosing a different room. Not recommended for families with small kids.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: annmariehc
Reviews.Content: I treated my mother for a long weekend in Boston, and we had a wonderful stay at the Courtyard. It was an easy walk from the train station when we arrived with suitcases, as well as convenient to the T and trolley stops. It's within walking distance of the library and Trinity Church (both gorgeous), the mall and skywalk. I personally thought the outside of the building was really attractive, not at all scary, and the rooms clean, comfortable, nicely decorated... I almost hesitate to recommend this place to others b/c I don't want it to be booked next time when I want to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous staff, very comfortable and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: buffyKernersville_Nc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times and the staff has been consistently excellent. they are very knowledgeable about the area, helpful in providing information, and even lent me an umbrella! This also extends to the wait staff in the restaurant. The food was very good, and reasonable. The location is very close to the T, and is a great walking area, being close to Boston Commons and Boston Public Gardens. Also within walking distance of some excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Boutique style Courtyard Priceless”
Reviews.Author: earlypeteblooms
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Courtyard Copley Square. The second stay was every bit as good as the first we were even welcomed back. We asked if it was possible to have the room we had last time but it was taken but the desk clerk got us an identical room on a different floor. The Copley has definitely become our hotel of choice for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Our Best Stay Ever in Boston”
Reviews.Author: galflorigal
Reviews.Content: We found the Courtyard Copley by chance we usually stay at the Long Wharf location but they were sold out. The front desk offered Copley as an alternative. We didn't know what to expect but we found to our suprise that although small the hotel was very comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful. The location was unbelievable and although not on the water had as many local attractions as that area. The rate we paid was a little high probably because it was a last minute booking. The agent did note that they always had specials online that are usually a lot better. We will give the Copley another try on our next visit if we an get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: rkornhauser
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful trip to Boston and was very pleased with our selection of the Copley Sq. Courtyard. It was far more reasonable than other hotels w/in a few blocks and the rooms were just fine for our purposes. Front desk personnel were friendly and accomodating. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable and convenient...worked for our family”
Reviews.Author: dmm625
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott Boston Copley Square so we could attend a family event nearby. From the minute we arrived the service was perfect and they went out of their way to be helpful. The car was taken care of, the room was ready early and we were given walking directions that were perfect. The room was spotless and very comfortable for our family with two small children. Later, after dinner and putting the kids to bed, my wife and I grabbed a bottle of wine from the self serve area and watched a movie. In the morning breakfast was ready when we were and check out was as easy as our check in. I would return and recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. Would Stay Again.”
Reviews.Author: angelmax11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard in Copley Square March 2011. The staff welcomed me and allowed me to check in early. My room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room was quiet. I will stay again if the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: ielsben
Reviews.Content: We stayed her over the weekend and had a horrible stay. This is my second time in Boston and decided to stay at a different hotel this time around; just to see a different part of the city especially with first timers with me. After this weekend, I regret not reserving at the one I stayed at last time. As soon as we got in the receptionist was very rude. Instead of saying, "I will be with you in a moment", she would say "Can you wait!" with an attitude. And upon checking out the next day, the same receptionist, gave an attitude to us because the printing of the bill didn't reflect her screen. Instead of kindly saying that she would print out another one, she made it seem like it was our fault and started rolling her eyes at us because we asked if we could get another copy of the bill. She (whose name begins with a D) was very disrespectful and I would never stay here again. She made the people in Boston look bad. Also, sleeping at night wasn't as pleasant, since we could hear all the drunk college kids screaming outside from our room in the wee hours of the morning. Free internet was the only plus but you can get that anywhere in Boston. Like I said, I should have stayed at the Hilton by the Prudential Center.

Reviews.Title: “Not so incredible weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jjazz10
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel on the weekend of march 26 hoping to have a good ground of sightseeing the city of Boston. The worst part of all is the hotel front desk who is a girl whose initials is D.V. has never been nice to us. She was so rude talking to us. In anyway I will ever recommend this hotel to anyone. All thumbsdown.

Reviews.Title: “In Boston's Back Bay: a little jewel in a big hotel chain's crown”
Reviews.Author: describe3
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here in March 2011, when I needed to be near Copley Square. I love the small, attractive size, with all the conveniences and efficiency of a major hotel chain. The front desk and valet service was first rate, and the gentleman who brought my daughter her rollaway bed was particularly nice. The buffet breakfast was extensive, and at all hours there are foods and magazines in the small lobby that make the lobby resemble a bed and breakfast. Very quiet too, despite the downtown Boston location.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Suprise”
Reviews.Author: jennyhexy
Reviews.Content: We tried the Boston Copley Square for the first time this trip. We had brought our parents up to visit the kids at Northeastern. My parents are fussy eaters and on the Saturday morning we were looking for something nice for breakfast outside the hotel. The young lady at the desk mentioned Thorntons but as we had stayed many times at the large Marriott we know Thorntons very well. Another older gentleman at the desk suggested we try a place on Boylston Street called the Back Bay Social Club. Well he must have noticed by my look I was a litle apprehensive at the suggestion. He told me to try it that we wouldnt dissapointed. He was right it was like an old style dining room from the 50's all wood and leather inside steeped in tradition and the service was unbelievable. Out of all our trips to Boston the staff at the Copley really made the stay memorable. My father was still takling about it two weeks later. Any help or suggestions we got at this hotel was exceptional the staff were freindly without fault. On our next visit our first choice will definitely be this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff had contagious friendliness”
Reviews.Author: jimpatcar
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its location and price. It seems to be a great value. Every staff member was very friendly and funny and welcoming. We felt very comfortable and would definately return to this hotel. Overall, it was a nice experience and a great value. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewWorldScribe
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this small Courtyard hotel are roomy and recently renovated. The location is on a side street, right near the Boston Public Library and Copley Place. so much nicer than the big convention hotels. One drawback is the underwhelming and overpriced breakfast. Otherwise, it's a great choice. And there's a nice Irish pub around the corner on Boyleston Street.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced but still upscale.”
Reviews.Author: DSantor0
Reviews.Content: Excellent value in the heart of Boston, right around the corner from Copley Square shopping and Newbury Street. Our room was spacious and clean, the entire hotel was up-to-date and spotless. It's not flashy, just the perfect mix of luxury and practicality, great for families with older kids.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, caring service”
Reviews.Author: JMK64
Reviews.Content: Great location and charming property. Used as a base for college visits. Front desk staff was fantastic! Very helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions. We were there for only one night but will use again if in the area and would strongly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Boston”
Reviews.Author: tri2eat
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Courtyard Marriott in Copley Square in Boston. The staff was welcoming, the rooms were comfortable and the beer tasting on Wednesday and wine tasting on Thursday was a treat. A very important amenity to me was the variety of pillow sizes for choices. Some were small and much flatter while others were full and puffy. Most hotels only have the big puffy ones that make my neck hurt by morning. As a solo traveler who rarely travels alone, I also felt very comfortable from a safety standpoint. The hotel is centrally located to the Back Bay area, a stone's throw from Boylston Street, the Boston Public Library and many fine restaurants and pubs. The T stops are also very close by. Enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service brings me back”
Reviews.Author: gerryboyNI
Reviews.Content: I would just like to give a shout out to the two Justins they never forget my name. No matter how long since my last visit. This time I was with my wife and we were celebrating 35 years together and we got a nice bottle of white wine to start off our evening. The staff didn't have to do anything but it is typical of the service I have come to expect at this hotel. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: 2foxy2ms
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay immensely at the Courtyard Copley the weather was terrible but the hotel had free hot coffee every morning and warm apple cider and cookies in the evening which the kids loved. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Will come back in the spring and hopefully see more of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome once again”
Reviews.Author: jakpot3
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best management staffs I have ever encountered in all my travels. I have stayed here before and showed interest in a particular room. When I booked the trip this time, I did it on line. When I arrived I was told that they recognized the name on the reservation and the room I prefered was blocked out for me. It's not like I am there every week, I am at this hotel a couple of times a year. That's great management and that's why I do come back.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: fernm61
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Marriott Copley Square offered us a good experience and no complaints. The check-in process was swift and personable. Our room was spacious and a offered all necessary amenities. Given the location of the room (across from the elevator) it was surprisingly quiet and also the street noise did not was not too loud to interfere with sleep. We have stayed at the Marriott Copley Square on previous occasions and would certainly recommend to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenience in the heart of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Frqntbiztravlr88
Reviews.Content: Quick, easy trip during rush hour from Logan on the T. Hotel is located about a block from the Copley T - less than 30 minute trip from baggage claim to check-in at 4:30PM. Convenient location, close to the numerous restaurants and shops in the Back Bay. Staff was very personable and breakfast was fine, typical Courtyard fare (you can never go wrong with the waffles!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Winter Deal”
Reviews.Author: Loguey60946
Reviews.Content: Got a promo offer from the Courtyard in Copley Square which was not available when we called reservations. However a quick call to the hotel solved our problem we spoke to one of the managers he was Scottish I think sorry I cant remember his name but he was very accommodating and got us the rate. In fact everyone we met at the hotel was very helpful and professional. The rooms were small, clean and very comfortable. Because of the weather we didnt take our car and we were told the hotel was only a five minute walk from the train station which was true. We ate at a nearby fish restaurant Atlantic Fish which was excellent. We will definitely be back but when the weather is better for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flygirlnh
Reviews.Content: Copley is the place to be - restaurants, theatre, walking distance to downtown. And this hotel was great. Use the valet parking. It's better for them to park in the Copley garage. Or better yet, don't bring a car to Boston. You don't need it. The room we had on the fifth floor was gigantic, clean, in-room Starbucks, breakfast was available downstairs but the Pru is across the street. We had a special rate - we were there over Thanksgiving and they were practcally giving rooms away. The staff was wonderful. I'd stay here over the big Marriott next door any day.

Reviews.Title: “The best value and location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: amberandchamois
Reviews.Content: Being from northern New England, Boston is a favorite destination for us for shopping, the Red Sox and other cultural events. We have stayed in many hotels in Boston over the years, for conferences or just for "going to Boston". The Copley Square area of Boston is, from our point of view, the best area for a hotel in Boston. We have stayed several times at the sister Marriott Copley Place hotel, the large conference-type regular Marriott hotel, just across the street. The Courtyard Copley Square is a much smaller, cozier, friendlier hotel, also less expensive. It is a great value, considering the cost of hotel rooms in Boston, one of the priciest cities for hotels in the country. The Courtyard Copley Sqaure reminds us of a true European-type hotel experience. The hotel does not have a dining room that offers lunch and dinner. The rooms are on the smaller side than you might find in other larger hotel chains, but the location can't be beat! Flat screen TV is nice, although it is not in HD. Our room was very clean with a god-sized, marble bathroom. Breakfast in their small but very nice breakfast room includes options for a good buffet or individual orders (worth the extra money), all made in their kitchen and not like the tasteless "free breakfasts" that are offered in many places (which we don't like and usually pass up). Several of Boston's BEST restaurants are within 1-2 blocks walking distance, plus the best shopping experience just across the street, including all the high-end shops, Tiffany, Saks Fifth Avenue, Lord & Taylor, Eileen Fisher, etc, plus a great Barnes & Noble, all within short walking distance and all located so that you don't need to go outdoors, especially good in the winter. Newbury Street and Boylston Street are just 1-2 blocks away, with many excellent boutiques and art galleries. The "T" subway stop is very close by. The Theatre District is about a 1 mile walk away, if you are going to the Theatre. Go for a drink in the Oak Room in the nearby Fairmont Copley Place Hotel (a Boston luxury), just a block away. A special touch at the end of a good shopping day. Stay here and take the "T" to Fenway Park for the Red Sox games!

Reviews.Title: “NOT WHAT I EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: ewave1984
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a busy street. We were located on the 2nd floor facing the street side. There was a fight that broke out about 2:30am with loud screaming and banging. This hotel is located directly across the street from a public parking. All we heard were people with loud voices walking the streets, cars honking their horns, people fighting in the streets. We hardly had any sleep during our 1 night stay. I am glad it was a 1 night stay. I am a marriott member but will not be staying at this hotel ever again. Beware that daily valet parking is a whopping $42 a day, what a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, great location nestled among the giants”
Reviews.Author: steakman55
Reviews.Content: Does not stand out visually, but in a restored older building. Small lobby and smallish room but hotel location is fantastic in Back Bay. Walking distance to many nice restaurants, and hotel staff at front desk was great. Would highly recommend as a nice place to stay that should be less expensive than the giant chains and independents nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Hammer328
Reviews.Content: A drop disappointing for a Courtyard. Used wash cloth left in the shower. Housekeeping could do a better job with the vacuum behind the mattress. I did get a good night's rest. Flat screen TV a pleasure. Very energetic and courteous staff and location is prime. Refrigerator in the room and excellent market directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Convenience”
Reviews.Author: dsoc
Reviews.Content: Excellent Courtyard in a great location. So convenient to everything including merchandise shopping, food shopping, restaurants, transportation. museums... Helpful staff and nice rooms. A great boutique style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: clmbs_traveller
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. We had a corner room on the seventh floor, which I think offered us additional space. Bathroom was quite spacious, although kind of wasted as the coutner space was limited. The front-desk service was VERY good. Multiple people there were very friendly and helpful with dinner reservations. Use them, if needed. While certainly a pricey hotel since it's in downtown Boston, the location was very convenient to many things, including Fenway Park We did not use the expensive nightly parking option, as we returned our Avis rental to a close-by location (3 blocks) just after checking in. Subway station is real close. Buy your weekly subway pass ($15) at Shaw's Supermarket -- which is practically across the street from the hotel. Breakfast options (included in our package) were quite flexible with buffet food vs. custom orders. Overall, a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Friendly Employees!”
Reviews.Author: Bsontonbride
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience staying here. All The people were so friendly and on top of things! We had a light bulb go out in the bathroom and they were there withing 5 minutes to replace it. The breakfast is wonderful in the morning and the coffee always fresh! They made sure our cab wasn't late and always greeted us as we came in and left!

Reviews.Title: “Gem at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: bfazio
Reviews.Content: room-1 bed-queen-good size. on 7th fl over looking city. clean but not much hanging space for suits for longer than a cple of days- bathroom: clean and good size. even girlfriend was impressed. workout room: in basement-small and would NOT rec that women head here alone. beware: 40/ night to park car-ouch. They also have storage space in unit for food but it is NOT a fridge-have to request one-found that out the hard way

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: richvabrew
Reviews.Content: We were in town for one night to watch a Sox game and didn't want to spend a ton of money. I saw a special on Travelzoo for this hotel and booked it. The room was small yet very clean and comfortable. We had a king room and slept really well. Thanks to a recommendation on the Boston forum about parking, we only paid $25 for the parking deck right across the street.. We had a great stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: BungleByrne
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a Red Sox game and we were told that this hotel was the closest Marriott to Fenway. It is actually about a twenty minute walk along Boylston Street which wasnt to bad. The staff told us that the T went from just beside the hotel but it was a nice evening so we decided to walk. The first thing we noticed was that there was so many shops, restaurants and bars in this area. I wish now I hadnt brought the car as the parking was a bit pricey $42 bucks a night and everything was within walking distance. The guy said at the desk we really didnt even need the car. I was staing on points anyway so what you gonna do. They had a Sam Adams beer tasting in the lobby that night which was great and we were told they do it every week. Free beer and the Red Sox. The room we had was a little small and when we asked to move they didnt have anything else they said the hotel was sold out. Maybe it was because we were on a points stay but the staff did say they are pretty much full all the time because of their location. The front desk also reccommended a seafood restaurant called the Atlantic Fish Company which was excellent and not to pricey for us. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I can talk my wife into coming to another game.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located; ordinary service”
Reviews.Author: FLTraveler88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was comp'd through frequent miles. Comfortable room, but service was so-so. Housekeeping was also mediocre. Cleaning supplies and dirty towels left by cleaning staff on our bathroom floor. Another guest had a bag of garbage outside their door for 2 days. A $4 bottle of water placed conveniently on the bar, was "free" in the lobby. there was no Wi-Fi connection in the room though they had ethernet cables. Beds were very comfortable as were the pillows. When we asked the hotel to call a taxi upon departure, the bellman called a friend in a TownCar across the street, assuring it was the same price. I specifically asked if the driver took Visa as we were low on cash. He said yes. When we got to the airport, driver could not find a Visa Ticket to run our card. It smelled of collusion. Location is convenient, and the stay "ok" if you dont plan to be in the room long.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: borntobeagambler
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff were excellent some of the best I ever encountered. Great area for restaurants, bars and shopping. Close to the T and public transportation. We had a car service to the airport the morning we left it was about the same price as a taxi. The hotel room didnt have a great view but we werent in it that much so it wasnt a big issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: purplejenn11
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for 4 nights for leisure. The plus - the service was great and the location was excellent. We could walk to many attractions. There is also a grocery store across the street (Shaws), which was great for stocking up on snacks and drinks. They provide an in room cooler, but did bring us a refrigerator upon request. The only minus is that the rooms were so tiny - the smallest I have ever stayed in. But it is fine if you are just in the room for sleeping. The black out curtians worked well and I got some great sleep here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and walking distance to many attractions.”
Reviews.Author: CMvu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and close to Prudential Tower, shopping, Copeley Square and Boston Library. They offered Samuel Adams beer tasting in the lobby in the evening. Quiet rooms with refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price for Boston”
Reviews.Author: bsk_10
Reviews.Content: Needed a place in the heart of Boston at a reasonable price. Both were found at the Marriott Courtyard. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Location was perfect. Our room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were spacious and gorgeous and staff was amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: MySkoogie1385
Reviews.Content: My 17-year old wanted to go to Boston and shop with friends for her birthday. I bravely drove 3 17-year olds to Boston to stay overnight at the Courtyard by Marriott Boston Copley Square. I chose this hotel because it is close to the Copley Mall, Prudential Mall and Newbury Street. From the moment we checked in until the time we checked out we were amazed by how friendly and knowledgeable the staff was. They even sent up some snacks for the girls when they overheard us say it was her birthday. When we got to our room we could not believe the size of it ! I have never been at a Marriott Courtyard with rooms this big! The girls joked that they could do cartwheels in the room (they didn't, don't worry !) We walked to the mall on Saturday night and again on Sunday and then to Newbury Street. I am sure that my daughter and her friends are never going to forget this !!

Reviews.Title: “Well located nice small hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: charlotte7474
Reviews.Content: Backbay area located small hotel, modern and good equipment. Unfortunately no WIFI. Very helpful and very friendly staff. Good breakfast selection. Coffee making facility in room. Close to shopping area: two malls with foodcourt and restaurants. Spacious bathrooms, comfortable beds. For a relaxing stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Choice in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mrg0137
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my family for one night while we were touring Boston. We were staying on Marriott Rewards points, and it was available, so we went for it for a night before moving across town to another hotel. The Courtyard is located in an historic restored apartment building, called 88 Exeter. We were a little bit confused when we first arrived, because all of the signage directly in front of the hotel entrance says 88 Exeter, rather than Courtyard by Marriott. We figured out we were in the correct place quickly enough once we looked up and saw the Courtyard sign. Just be aware, this hotel is also referred to as 88 Exeter. The location of the hotel is only about 1 block from Copley Square, and right in the thick of a nice area with lots of other hotels, restaurants, and shopping within a couple of blocks, like the Copley Place mall, Prudential Center, and departure point for different tours like the popular duck tours. There is a Lord & Taylor directly across the street, as well as a Shawâ€™s supermarket, which found was helpful for picking up some snacks. Nearby restaurants include many chains, like California Pizza Kitchen, Uno, Cheesecake Factory, and PF Changâ€™s, as well as Dunkinâ€™ Donuts and Starbucks for coffee. There didnâ€™t appear to be too many independent restaurants nearby, but we really didnâ€™t walk too far away from the hotel. The area around the hotel is very nice, tourist-friendly, and safe. We arrived at the hotel around noon and were able to check-into our room with 2 queen beds. The lobby in the hotel is a bit awkward, probably due to the architectural constraints of the building. The front desk is right there when you walk in, with the rest of the lobby, or library, as the front desk staff referred to it, in a room attached. The library room includes one computer with internet access, as well as several seating areas. One odd thing we noticed in the lobby was a padlocked refrigerator of alcohol that sits in the empty lobby area near the front desk. It seemed a bit odd and tacky to have that sitting in the lobby the way it was, and Iâ€™m not sure why it was there. When checking us in, front desk staff was efficient, but definitely lacking in friendliness. Each time you walk into the hotel, you have to walk right past the front desk, since itâ€™s right by the elevators and front door, but never once did the front desk staff greet us in the few times we went in and out. There wasnâ€™t a real sense of welcoming at this hotel. I would think this would be a priority at a hotel that is trying to brand itself as a boutique version of Courtyard by Marriott. Our room was located on the top floor, which I believe is the 10th. Since it is a relatively small hotel, there are only about 7 or 8 rooms on each floor. Our room was located on the end of our floor, which meant it was a very nice size! The room was oddly shaped, and had interesting walls that curved up to the ceiling, which gave it some character. The room had an open foyer area right when we walked in, with a table and a bit of open space, which we found to be good for storing our luggage. The room was otherwise a standard Courtyard room, with the typical bedding and dÃ©cor. The area beyond the foyer seemed larger than a typical room, probably because of the odd shape. Everything was very clean and in good condition. The tv looked like it was recently replaced with a new flat screen. We had a fine view across to the shopping areas by Copley Place. The bathroom was also relatively large, although not very upgraded. It was a bit stripped down looking, without any upscale fixtures. However, it was just fine for our night, and standard for a Courtyard. Overall, the room was very comfortable and quite large for a city hotel room. I have the feeling every room in this hotel is different. Our room was also very quiet, and there is free internet via an Ethernet connection. One small complaint I had was that the desk area wasnâ€™t overly functional for working. The desk chair was too low for comfortable working on the desk, and the tv took up a bunch of space that would otherwise be good desk space. The room also had a small refrigerator in it, although it didnâ€™t get overly cold. Parking at the hotel is $42 per night, and the valets were not always around. When we first arrived, we had to request that the car be taken, but later in the night, when we got our car out, there was a valet available. They were very responsive when they were around. When we needed a taxi, there were none right by the hotel, and it would have been helpful to have a valet there to call one for us. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Iâ€™m not generally a fan of the Courtyard chain, but we gave it a chance, and it impressed me. The boutique-ish style of it and interesting room made it unique. I only wish the hotel could let the unique building and all of its character stand out more. The hotel has been made a bit modern and up-to-date, to conform to the standard Courtyard look. I wish they were able to decorate the hotel more in keeping with the style of the building. I would also have liked a friendlier staff to make us feel more welcome in the hotel. Otherwise, itâ€™s good. Itâ€™s in a very nice location for touring Boston, and itâ€™s clean and comfortable. It was a great value for us, using points. The rooms were going for around $250 per night when we were there. Iâ€™m not sure if itâ€™s really worth this much. I know hotels in Boston are pricey, but I think you may be able to find something slightly better for that price point. Itâ€™s a solid choice, but it definitely lacks any real luxury and grandeur if thatâ€™s what youâ€™re looking for. I think with a couple small changes, the hotel could have it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: lc1113
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for the 4th of July weekend. This was the best rated hotel we found on tripadvisor for the value. Cheapest hotel I found after a thorough search and it was worth it. The front desk staff was great and really helpful; the room was ready right upon early check-in; Breakfast was included in my package and was good. We parked in the garage across the street - About $33 dollars the night, but finding a cheaper one was difficult. This was convenient to the hotel. Definitely walking distance to nearby Newbury street shopping, restaurants and Fenway (about 25 min walk). Would stay here again next time in Boston...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, steps to everything”
Reviews.Author: SMarston
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Marriott in Boston - everything was really close by and we walked or took the subway during our 2 night stay. We enjoyed Copley Square and Newbury Street - really didn't end up spending that much time in the hotel because there was so much to see. It was a basic, clean, easy access hotel. Nothing extra special, but all that we needed for the Boston end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a bit worn”
Reviews.Author: ZipZoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a year or two ago and were pleased with that stay. This time, however, we were given a smaller room and its decor was getting pretty long in the tooth (guess that 'elite' Marriott rewards thing doesn't count for much)--with stains on the carpet, smudges on the ceiling over the HVAC vent, and a comforter that didn't manage to cover the bare box spring. While there is a computer and printer in the downstairs lounge (a particularly nice touch for those who need to print boarding passes), the in-room computer access was plug-in only with no Wi-Fi, so I couldn't access email there on my iPod. A large wide-screen TV offered a stretched picture, with no way to adjust the view. With breakfast (not included), parking, and taxes, our $212 daily rate ended up being about $300 a night. The location is still great, and service helpful, but this hotel didn't seem to provide as much value this time around.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kathen302
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we're Marriott rewards members and we had to check into the Sheraton Boston the next day for a conference which was more expensive. The lobby has to be the smallest lobby I've ever been in but still updated and clean. The staff were very efficient and friendly. We had to ask for directions several times and they never acted inconvenienced. You're a 10 minute walk from Boston Common, which is where we parked. Tons of shopping and restaurants on Boyleston. Tubes can take you to the waterfront or fenway. I do think it was a little over priced but I realize its the city so what can you do?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Anna2349
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a larger room even without asking. Justin at the front desk was very helpful and gave us free breakfast and fixed the noise from the air conditioner right away. Right near shopping and the subway, walking distance to all. Comfortable stay. Not as fancy as the Marriott next door, but if you are just sleeping there, it is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Just terrible all around...”
Reviews.Author: DeAnnFreitag
Reviews.Content: Paid $249/nite for 4 nites while in town for a convention. Left at 7:30am and would return at 3pm and the room had not been cleaned yet. One day, the cleaners were in the room NEXT DOOR to mine when I left at 9am and upon a 3pm return, my room was still not cleaned. I mentioned it to the front desk when I left again at 4pm and suprise was the reaction - like they had no idea it had not been cleaned and the cleaners had left the premises. Which means it would have been dirty when I returned again at 10:30pm if I had not said something. Had a box of written seminar materials to ship home. Delivered it to the front desk at 2pm one afternoon and the desk agent said the manager came on duty at 3pm and he would get a FedEx quote. We ensured my cell phone number was on record for communication. I returned at 11pm. Realized I did not have any message on my room phone nor had I received any cell phone messages. Called the front desk. The current story was the manager couldn't help after all; FedEx has to take the package to its location in order to give me a quote. I should have just taken it to another **full service** hotel in the first place. I missed seminars the following day taking care of this request since the hotel has no amenities at all. Tissues went to the "about out" color one morning. That evening, no additional box was left during cleaning and sure enough, I had to call for more tissues that evening (and to get through the next morning). Towels are thin and pathetic. There isn't any water pressure - hard to get shampoo out of one's hair. Had to call for additional hangars just to unpack once I arrived. The Westin and the Copley Square are within 1 block of this place. They HAVE to be better than this. Too expensive and inconvenient for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the cleanest, friendliest, most comfortable hotel I've experienced”
Reviews.Author: buggsy62
Reviews.Content: I have just completed an eight night stay at this hotel. This was my first time in Boston (which I loved) and I am so pleased I chose this hotel. The first thing I always look for in a room is how clean it is. This room was spotless and was kept that way through the whole week. The staff who work here are first class.....I am not usually gushing in praise when I write reviews, but if a team do their job better than anyone else then they deserve the praise. Some notes on the practical points.... The room was a fairly average room size. Not huge but more than adequate. The internet from the room worked well. I also used the computer and printer in the lounge to print off my boarding passes for the trip home. The bed was excellent and I think that because the room was also quiet (despite the hotel being full) I had the best sleep in a hotel I have ever had. The bathroom was nice and included a bath....how much can you say about a bathroom? I had breakfast in the dining room most mornings. This was OK. Not a lot of variety , though. Eggs, sausages, bacon, toast or you could have cereals or make a waffle. I was able to leave my bags there after checkout which was very handy given I had a late flight out. It also had the subway very close and was within easy walking distance to the theatre district, the symphony hall, the Boston Common and transport centre. If I am fortunate enough to go to Boston again this is where I will stay. Loved it! I would have no hesitation in recommending this

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: NYBob6
Reviews.Content: Rooms are adequate in size, very clean, and QUIET!!. Very convenient location. Bed had good support. Parking across the street is $42 valet, $39 if you do it yourself. I googled Parking Near Copley Square and found an indoor garage 10 minutes away....3 blocks....for $29 overnight. Front desk people very friendly and helpful. A 20 minute walk to Fenway Park. (Yankees killed the Sox!) Minor complaint...the towels, while abundant, are kind of t;hin....not lush. I made a reservations early and got a good price (I think) of $169. I'd definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “A real hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: bigoldog
Reviews.Content: If you are running the marathon there is no better place than here . It is close to everything . The staff is first class and the rooms are cozy and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better service”
Reviews.Author: dcborn61
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Courtyard Copley Square this past weekend for the 2nd time. We love the location, convenient to restaurants and shopping. Last time we even took the duck tour which starts right around the corner. This visit the location came in even more handy, as we walked back to the hotel from a Red Sox game at Fenway. Avoided all the traffic and T congestion, even stopped at Red Mango along the way! This visit we had the great fortune to be greeted by Andrea for check-in. She did everything right, she noted that we had stayed there before and welcomed us back. She confirmed that my Marriott Rewards number was with the reservation. She offered to provide any assistance necessary to make our stay more enjoyable. All in a 3 minute interaction. Set the tone for a wonderful visit for my family. Boston hotels are all pretty expensive. It's nice to have a hotel in town where you can feel comfortable and at-home.

Reviews.Title: “what a great place ,clean ,location is great ,helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Briflies
Reviews.Content: I travel often and let me be the first to say this is a great place to stay.. Location first of all is right near all attractions ,food, theaters. All within walking distance no need to take cabs or remove car from parking garage dirrectly across the streeet. Very clean rooms, comfortable beds, great value. The staff was probably the freindliest and most helpful you willl find in Boston..

Reviews.Title: “did not meet their or my standards”
Reviews.Author: alan6668
Reviews.Content: Was in a 1 bedroom suite; sofa bed mattress was torn, had gaping holes, and was unusable. refrigerator was broken. had to settle for roll-out bed in the front room which took up all the available floor space and made the front room unusable except for sleep. manager at night lied to us and said the fridge was not a fridge but rather a "cooler." told him the next morning that i knew what a broken refrigerator was. they brought in a new one and placed it on the floor, not replacing the broken one in the cabinet, indicating to me that they were going to leave the broken one for the next guest. complained to marriott on their website afterwards and they would only offer me useless points on their rewards card, which i declined. told them i expected better than this from marriott,not unusable mattresses, broken refrigerators, and lying managers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: ilcoman
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 days in Boston at Courtyard by Marriott Boston Copley Square. Location: I chose the place because it was .8 miles from the place I needed go to and I've got a very good rate (129$/night - with free Internet -the price/value for downtown Boston was great). The location is great...next to Prudential plaza with links to public transportation all over the place. One has a wide range of places to eat and get entertained (if you have time for this). The Parking is right across the street (valet parking for 42$/day would allow you to take the car in and out - just pull the car in front of the hotel/ if you don't need to use the car during the stay then park it yourself in the structure for 39$/day). Moreover, while walking I found behind the parking a very nice (large) supermarket - if you miss anything. Accommodation: I found the room to be very good (standard room/king size bed). Clean, neat, comfortable bed, handy desk, and I had a nice view towards the street but because of the location not all rooms might have that (I assume some rooms might have the view of a corner of the next door building - but I personally don't spend too much time looking out the window). I stayed at one of the upper floors and I didn't have any problems with street noise. I arrived very early in the morning and the staff was really nice and arranged for me to get in the room right away before going out for meetings. I didn't eat breakfast in the hotel so I can't comment on that but they offer one...there are so many places close by to get an espresso. Overall I think it is a very nice place to stay at. I will consider the place for my future visits in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: gillian1111
Reviews.Content: This Marriott was a great hotel. The front desk staff was very helpful. They even made us a reservation at a restaurant and we did not have to wait to be seated. They also gave us suggestions about where to go out to eat, bars and shopping. The room was very spacious and clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: BelkisY
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay and loved the city the food the people. A bit cold but nothing a good coat can't handle!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Warm atmosphere and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: jakpot3
Reviews.Content: They advertised a lower rate after I made my reservation. I called the hotel and they said the rate was no longer available. When I checked in the front desk manager gave me the lower rate anyway. He did not have to that but showed good business since I stay there about once a month. He acknowledged my loyalty and made me want to go back. This is a class hotel, great spot, great staff and very comfortable. No one should ever hesitate about staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: ampmm
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Copley Courtyard this past Saturday night. We enjoyed everything about our stay. We called on our way down to see if we could get an early check-in. The gentleman who answered stated absolutely, our room was ready and to come on down. When we arrived that same gentleman (I'm guessing) was very friendly and remarked that he had given us a wonderful room. He was right. Loved the room. I had requested a high floor and we were on the top floor. The room was a decent size with beautiful windows and a nice view of the city. The bathroom was huge. Everything was very clean. We didn't spend much time at the hotel, but everyone we came in contact with was incredibly courteous which contributed to our appreciation for the hotel. Breakfast smelled wonderful in the morning, however we had alternate plans and did not eat at the hotel. Location was great - very convenient to shopping, restaurants, bars and an easy cab ride to other Boston neighborhoods. The hotel only has 81 rooms so it is not huge and overcrowded, which I prefer. We will definitely stay at this hotel whenever we spend an evening down in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: smith837
Reviews.Content: As a gold member I travel quite frequently to Boston and New York, and I must say my stay at the Courtyard Copley truly was like being at home! From the valet out front to the amazing front desk staff, everyone was so welcoming and made my hectic business trip more relaxing. My room was clean, and had a great view of Exeter St. The gentleman working breakfast was so friendly, and the front desk staff had great suggestions on restaurants (check out Stephanies!) and things to do in the area. I look forward to returning to the Courtyard Copley next time I do business in Back Bay. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: n8vca
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard by Marriot Boston Copley Square. We were given a corner room on about the 6th floor which had a nice view of the city down below. This was our first time in Boston and this hotel was close to a lot of restaurants and stores. The room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. We did have the breakfast in the morning downstairs both days we were there and it was very good also. All in all we really enjoyed our stay there and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better staff”
Reviews.Author: kpdaddario
Reviews.Content: Traveling weekly can always get a little tiring and old, but this is a good hotel at a fantastic location with a top notch staff. Lawrence, Andrea, and especially Jennifer were friendly and went out of their way to make me feel welcome. The staff is what makes any hotel, and these guys were great.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: dsess
Reviews.Content: You cant beat the location. Walking distance to Fenway and most of the other boston attractions. You are right near the Prudential Center indoor mall-type place which gives you tons of shopping options. You can pay a lot of hotels in Boston and this one probably you more spacious rooms than the pricier Westin and Marriott across the street, albeit with fewer amenities. If you are looking for value, this a better option. IF you are looking for a big gym, nice bar, room service etc, go to the Marriott across the street.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: brucerobin
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing find. The staff were so friendly and welcoming.The rooms were very clean and comfortable. We really enjoyed the decor, and the breakfast restaurant was superb. The location could not have been better, just able to walk along the road to Stephanies and many other local restaurants that were recommended to us.Being straight across the road from the supermarket and the 104 shops in The Prudential Centre makes this an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “great reception and relaxing after bustle of boston traffice and people”
Reviews.Author: nomadnewbrunswick
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed this hotel as it is a lot quieter than the other bigger hotels and service is available immediately with excellent staff. the rooms were clean and a very good size. the location is excellent. since it is a smaller hotel than the marriott on huntington and others there is no pool which is not a priority with us as we usually never have time for a swim anyway. the beds of course are the best. because boston is so busy all the time this hotel is a welcoming relief after being out and about. the staff was the best and very very friendly and helpful. the beds at the marriott are the most comfortable we have slept on anywhere and you have to wonder about people who do not like them. i will say though that some people who travel have to find something wrong with something and are very demanding. I find when you are pleasant and friendly with staff they respond likewise. they are proud of their hotel and go to great lengths to help you out. this was the case with our stay and i certainly would recommend this hotel to others. the location is great and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “octoberfest!”
Reviews.Author: Fenwayfaithful02116
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on their Sam Adams getaway package and it was awesome! Rate included 6 beers, some souvenirs and breakfast. Staff was great - room was bigger then I thought considering it's a downtown hotel. I already have my reservation to go back for the tree lighting in faneul hall

Reviews.Title: “would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mikey65
Reviews.Content: staff was nice,view beautiful. when we checked in they said they were giving us an upgrade to a suite. it was not a suite,but a conference room. tv was on wall where you could not watch it from the bed and the bed was very,very uncomfortable. some upgrade. never again. we should have looked at the room first.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but vould improve on a few things”
Reviews.Author: NemoTraveler
Reviews.Content: My souse and I stayed here for 3 nights. The location is good - close to most attractions, and at the same time there is not too much noise from the trafic. We got a fairly big room, which was very clean. The beds were of a good quality, and we liked the furnishing. Bathroom also very clean. Breakfast was included in our rate and was of good quality. At arrival we did not get the coupons needed to pay for it, which had to be resolved the first morning. The service in the breakfastroom was generelly ok - one member of the staff gave outstanding service, another seemed to have a bad day. The wired internet connection worked well. However, for some strange reason, we were only given access for 48 hours, ie 2 days, which seemed to be the standard. I contacted the reception about this problem, but they only told me to phone the provider directly. I would have expected the hotel to help, as we were probably not the first guests to encounter this. In the end, I solved it myself in 5 minutes (a cookie from the provider had to be deleted). There are several nice restaurants and shops in the area, and overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Travel159549
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Courtyard Marriott, but nothing special. Our room was missing its refrigerator, and the fitness center was tiny. We stayed using points, so I can't comment too much on the value, but we stayed the next night in a nearby Westin property, and found it much nicer. The location is decent (near Copley Square, Boston Public Library, and somewhat close to Fenway Park). The check-in receptionist was very friendly and helpful, and the check-out time was noon (much nicer than some places that use 10 or 11).

Reviews.Title: “Hurray for Handicap Accessible”
Reviews.Author: UOI
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel in general but am writing to report that the handicap accessible room and other services for my father were excellent. We requested bed linen changes, sets of extra towels, a wheelchair, etc., all of which were provided promptly. The room was beautiful, excellent view from the two double beds, comfortable and spacious. The rooms are nicer than they appear in the pictures where they seemed a bit dowdy to me. The roll in shower with built in bench was well designed and very functional for a totally non-ambulatory, zero-weight bearing person. This Marriott has an ADA specialist who helped us with the reservation. Valet parking was super fast; we would call for our car from the room and by the time we arrived it was there. UOI

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, friendly service, great value for family”
Reviews.Author: lafam
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter and I stayed here for two nights earlier this month and had a very nice stay. The room was very clean, spacious and quiet. The location right near the Prudential and Copley Square malls, Newbury St. and numerous restaurants cannot be beat. It was also convenient to have the upscale 24-hour Shaw's supermarket close by so we could stock up on breakfast items and drinks. Like every Marriott I have stayed at, the service was wonderful. The bellhop who took our bags to the room was very friendly, polite and even volunteered to bring a mini refrigerator to our room as he noticed we only had a cooler. The front desk clerks were all cheerful and helpful, and housekeeping staff kept everything nice and clean. It was also nice to have free internet in the room. The only slightly negative thing was that the shower was very basic ( medium flow pressure and no hand held extension) and there was no tub. Overall. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, small clean rooms, nice staff, not fancy”
Reviews.Author: nycpoetess
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Fantastic location, 1 minute walk to the Prudential Center which houses the Gucci store, Legal Seafood, Shaw's Supermarket, several shops, a food court, etc. Close to the T stop, banks, restaurants and tons of other hotel i.e. The Lenox, Four Seasons, Marriott. There is a club next door, but I didn't get to check it out. I had a view of Lord & Taylor, which is a huge temptation for a shopaholic :-) The staff is nice, location is great, room was clean. My room was ready at 11 am which was great because it was too cold to kill time walking around outside. It's not a big fancy hotel but its probably the best bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, beautiful and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaH1
Reviews.Content: The hotel that we stayed in was very elegant and clean. The rooms were larger than average and very spacious, especially for the five of us that went. The hotel was also very large, outside of the room, with beautiful decor and much more. There was lots to do as well as explore. (A four star hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond to make sure we were happy.”
Reviews.Author: mrwhited
Reviews.Content: The staff went above and beyond to make sure we had a great stay. From the moment we arrived in the rain they quickly got us from the cab to the lobby right to the very end of the stay. Great location, great service, we will definately stay agin when we return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The valet is nice, but I hope you don't like hot water. You won't have any.”
Reviews.Author: raggail
Reviews.Content: I've written several reviews for Trip Advisor and use Trip Advisor for planning where to stay. I always look for two things when reading reviews--the date the person stayed and the objectivity of the review. In all of my reviews, I've had wonderful experiences; however, our experience here was so awful that not only did we speak with the manager, but the manager gave us one of our two nights for free. Let me explain: When we arrived, the front desk and valet were exceptionally wonderful. Absolutely marvelous, I cannot say enough nice things about them. After traveling for several days with few clean clothes left, I decided to wash some clothes while my boyfriend slept. The one washer and dryer available were a nice touch, but I cringe to think what would happen should more than one person want to wash clothes. Plus, the room is so small and so hot and musty that I actually had problems breathing. No worries, as I didn't plan to be in there long. I went to take a shower while my clothes were washing; the shower, even after many, many minutes of running, had no hot water. Lukewarm would be a generous description. Also, there were small flying bugs, only a few that seemed to come from the drain mind you, but I do not pay additional occupancy for bugs in my room. I thought that perhaps the hot water situation would be remedied the next day and went to put my clothes in the dryer. After the proper amount of time and while using the provided available wireless Internet in the lobby, I returned to fold my clothes. That would have been possible, had the one dryer not been so old and used so much that my clothes apparently pushed against the door and had quit drying some time ago. Again, no problem. I used every available space to hang clothes in the room so they could dry, since I had no intention of spending additional time in the small closet of a hot washroom to make sure the dryer worked as it should have. The rooms are tiny, by the way--comfortable enough for two people, but definitely small. The next morning, my boyfriend went to take a never-warm shower; this time, he did call the front desk and alert them to the situation. The clerk reported the problem and a maintenance person did come immediately, which we were thrilled with, especially for a Sunday morning. After running the water for a while, he explained that there had been problems with the pipes and to run the water for a half-hour until it warmed up. After a full day of touring on the trolly, a wonderful experience where you can get on and off the trolly at certain stops and stay as long as you like with the added bonus of wonderful drivers who are very knowledgeable, I wanted nothing more than a cold drink while my boyfriend rested. I bought a beer from the small fridge and had to ask the front staff to open the bottle, since I don't carry a bottle opener on my person. One of the staff made mention that he "never drink[s]" and was not able, as in didn't know how to, open my bottle. What someone does in his own time is his own business but that wasn't professional in the least. When I later bought another beer to take upstairs for my boyfriend, the other clerk said that it seemed I had already bought enough; perhaps she was joking but again, someone who is spending that kind of money for a room deserves a little less judgmental conversation. The next day, after again being woken by the room next door making quite loud noise (I think it was more the people in the room than the room itself, since the dad was yelling at his kids at 6 a.m. Lovely, yes?), my boyfriend again tried to take a shower. He let the water run for 45 minutes before finally just taking a cold shower. I would almost attribute the coldness of the shower to so many people taxing the system, except I took a shower at 10 a.m. and it was still cold. I didn't notice any bugs this time, fortunately. We packed our stuff, said thank you to the housekeeping staff who were working hard and did a good job of keeping the place clean and left. How do I know the housekeeping staff kept the place clean? There was a vacuum cleaner parked half the day before in front of our elevator, right across from our room. It seemed more of a safety issue than anything, but it wasn't bothersome if you don't have children, bags, or anything in your hand and don't mind going around or moving a vacuum cleaner. We told the front desk clerk about our issues and asked to speak to the manager; the desk clerk was wonderful and professional and even made small talk while we waited for the manager. She also mentioned that someone before us had made the exact same complaints--no hot water and bugs in the shower--about a room on the same floor. We spoke with the manager and politely explained what had happened, where he finally did take off one night's stay. By the way, there are breakfast vouchers allowed in the mornings for a hot breakfast; steer clear if you can, though. It's not that great and I'm still waiting on my second cup of coffee. The kitchen staff seemed nice; the "hostess" seemed a little stressed by the six people in the room. The valet was absolutely wonderful and very helpful, and one front desk clerk with the Irish accent (I'm so sorry I didn't get your name) was so helpful and willing to give us tips about things to do. I wish it had been a better stay and I wish I had better things to say; this was our last stop on a beautiful trip and had it not been for the city of Boston and the tour, the entire Boston trip would have been spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Personality Plus”
Reviews.Author: LaxnFH
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while taking my daughter for college orientation. We were greeted by an extremely friendly gentleman at the front desk. Our flight had arrived earlier than our check in. He was quick to make a few calls to see if any room could be made ready earlier. He took our luggage and made suggestions where we could walk to have a meal. Within less than an hour he called our cell phone to tell us our room was ready. Every staff member we encountered was just as friendly. We had stayed at the larger Marriott Copley Square a few monthe s earlier. That was fine but this quaint Courtyard marriott far exceeded our expectations. We will use this hotel for all of our visits to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but needs refreshing”
Reviews.Author: bandogal
Reviews.Content: This hotel and staff are great however the hotel need some sprucing up. Our carpet was old and stained. The hotel location is fantastic and it is a quiet hotel. Near to the train station, shopping and atractions. The rooms are large and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Better then most”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedVet11
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston looking at local colleges, & it was actually my daughter who found this hotel off of it's twitter profile ( Twitter.com/BostonMarriott ) they offered a discount on the site for being a follower- There wasnt a huge difference but in this economy, every little bit counts. We were both pleasantly surprised by the great location, within walking distance to 3 of the 4 school she was looking at. Room with 2 queen beds was plenty of enough room for the two of us. Breakfast was pricey for what was offered but desk wasn't shy about giving us alternative options.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit cramped, but a good place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: alMossah
Reviews.Content: Rooms small and dark. Air conditioning quiet. Bed comfy. Bath and shower good. Only ate breakfast in the hotel once; not great, but OK. If you want breakfast, walk onto Newbury St and find Charley's (3 or so blocks west).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: JerMamma
Reviews.Content: We were stayed here for 3 nights. Upon our arrival, about 10PM we were greeted by a very pleasant vallet! We had rented a rental car, to use for the other 4 days of our trip, but while in Boston, we didn't need it at all! We were able to walk one block down to Boylson Street, which had lots restaurants and shopping, and Newbury street is just a block more. We never ate at the hotel, we just walked down to Boylson or Newbury street to find something. We were able to walk to Boston Commons, Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market place, and even walked to the North End/Little Italy. There was a computer and printer we used in the front lounge for free. We thought our room was kind of smallish, though it was on the top floor. We got a King, and from other reviews I've read it may have been a wee bit bigger than other rooms, it was fine for the two of us, but not for many more, but it was clean, quiet, and the shower was great!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: dthomas278
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely one we would return to. To begin with, it was very clean. The room was not large, but it was beautifully appointed and well laid out. Everyone we met was extremely friendly and helpful. The price is commensurate with other hotels in its category in this area. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend that our friends use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance and personal service”
Reviews.Author: Kelkiley
Reviews.Content: We have always had a nice stay in this hotel. IIt is in a very good location for waking and taking the T.The staff is very helpful most of the time and always says hello when you come downstairs. The only thing I would changeis that they need to offer free breakfast. They do have great evening themes such as the chocolate night and the Sam Adams night..this works nicely for families and business people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trippin_it_up
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Copley in June on business. I have not stayed in a Courtyard in years. My first impression of the room was - wow - things have changed in the past few years. The rooms are comfortable and nice. The hotel is in a great location. The gym is lacking, but the Charles is only a few blocks away for great running.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Service and Hot Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Hurl55
Reviews.Content: From the Valet parking, Front Desk, housekeeping staff to the choice of a hot cooked buffet or individual breakfast - it was just right! The staff was cordial, polite and showed great customer service. The hot breakfast was restaurant quality and was a nice change from the cold breakfast buffets! If you like building architecture, history and a cozy room this is a great place to stay. From our room with the arched windows, we had a great view of the Prudential Center. We felt quite safe in the room and hotel. The room and in particular, the bathroom, was quite clean. We are definitely planning on staying here when we come to Boston again! Big hotel experience in a cheaper and more cozy environment - you have to try this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “New Family Favorite”
Reviews.Author: StayCationer123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the courtyard by marriott last week with my wife and 2 children as a weekend away from home. We chose the courtyard because of its close proximity to fenway and good restaurants. We found the staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful. And the Sam Adams beer activity in the lobby was a huge plus! - Rooms were very clean and we received all requests prior to checking in. Over all I would give the Courtyard a perfect score.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: MizzouinKansas
Reviews.Content: Great Location for Sightseeing, local transportation, and dining. What makes this Hotel unique is the incredible friendliness of the staff. They were always available for assistance, recommendations, and suggestions. I have stayed in many Marriott's around the World but never one where the staff actually acted as though they were glad you were staying at their Hotel. The location drives the price but this location was ideal for Boston University's Graduation, sightseeing, and dining. The Hotel definitely exceeded our expectations and added to a very restful and pleasurable trip to a wonderful City.

Reviews.Title: “great location, tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: nkereina
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston for the first time with my boyfriend on Tuesday May 19. We stayed just for one night. We were in town for sightseeing, shopping and to go to a Red Sox game at Fenway. I chose this hotel because it was cheaper than the other options and seemed to be in a great location. We took the T from the airport and were able to find the hotel easily. It is about 3 blocks from the green line so it was convenient to the T. We arrived around 10am. I had requested early check-in when I made my reservation. No rooms were available when I arrived. They stored our luggage and we returned around 3:30 and got our room. I requested a room on a high floor but was placed on the 4th floor. Our room was TINY! If I was traveling with someone other than my boyfriend, we would have had to switch rooms. It was even a little cramped with my boyfriend. If I was alone, it would have been fine. We had a king size bed that was almost pushed up against the windows. There was a small space to walk sideways between the bed and the windows. The TV was on the side wall so you had to lay sideways in the bed to see the TV and the person on the far side could barely see the TV. The bathroom was across from the bed about a foot away so if someone turned the light on in the bathroom while someone was sleeping, it was a bother. It appears that this hotel was not a hotel at one point so I think probably all the rooms are different sizes. We were in a corner room near the elevator, which we never heard. Also, there was no view. We overlooked a building and an alley. I will say the good points of the room was that it was very clean, the bathroom was a good size, we had plenty of towels and toiletries and the TV had a lot of channels. The bed was really comfortable, but I have yet to meet a Marriott bed that I did not like. We didn't complain about anything because we were only in the room to sleep and shower. I would have requested a different room if we were there for longer. Both of the employees we encountered at the front desk and valet were really nice and helpful. They gave great directions. The hotel offered complimentary cookies upon check-in, and also complimentary snacks and beverages prior to the Red Sox game, which I think might be prior to every Red Sox home game. They also had a computer and printer which we were able to use for free to print our boarding passes. The location of the hotel is the best part about it. It's in the Copley Square area. It's across the street from Prudential Center and the Boston Duck Tours, which I also recommend. It's around the corner from a large 24 hour supermarket. It's two blocks from the heart of Newbury Street. It's a long walk to Fenway Park, but doable. The weather was nice and we don't mind walking so we walked to Fenway and back. It's an easy walk, a straight shot. The subway can also be taken there. There was signs at the parking garage across from the hotel advertising Red Sox parking. I don't think there's many hotels closer to Fenway anyways. We walked back from Fenway around 11pm and felt safe. The hotel is in an area with a ton of other hotels and it was nice. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurant but I looked at their breakfast menu. it was small but reasonably priced. Just a block away is Boylston St where there is a ton of bars and restaurants. Check-out was fine, no complaints. They stored our luggage until we left at 7pm with no problem. I would stay at this hotel again if I wanted to stay in this area again. The location was convenient and everyone was nice and everything was clean. I'd just switch rooms if I got another small one.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel in a great area - the price is too much!”
Reviews.Author: chapetx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a wedding and in celebration of my 6 month wedding anniversary. We were given a nice corner room. It was clean but looked old and worn. The bed was comfortable. Our curtains were messed up and let in a lot of light - not the best when you are trying to sleep in. We paid $300 a night plus $42 a day for parking. For not much more I feel like I could have stayed at the Ritz or Four Seasons. The hotel is in a great location - an easy walk to most attactions. I had been in Boston two weekends before and stayed at the Renaissance Waterfront hotel (which is owned by Marriot). It's a but further from the center of Boston but the price was almost $100 less a night, the rooms where cleaner and nicer. I recommed you stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, service & value”
Reviews.Author: AgentQ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice, now, and I have found it to be a great location & value. It is tucked in between Copley Square and the Prudential Center, just a block or so from Boylston Street and the shops on Newbury Street. The desk help has always been friendly, courteous and helpful. The first room I stayed in was a king on the 8th floor. It was very tastefully decorated, had free internet, flat screen TV and a minifridge. The view wasn't great, but it was quiet. Everything looked clean and contemporary. When we called for extra towels, they were delivered. The room was always cleaned, even though we didn't leave our room until 2pm one day. We never tried the breakfast which is available downstairs until 10 or 11am. The second room we stayed in was a king, but smaller and not laid out as well. The view was of Exeter Street, but noisier. The bed wasn't quite as comfortable. All-in-all, it is an above average Courtyard and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the central location and excellent customer care to make the trip enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Globaltravelers12
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Marriott Courtyard at Copley Sq in Boston over the last few days. Excellent location in the middle of the city with easy access to subways and buses as well as within walking distance of the shopping areas of Newbury Street. The rooms are spacious and clean and the front desk staff very helpful and personable. They want to make your trip enjoyable and comfortable. Overall, it is a well trained team with excellent customer care. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: ReadHere
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights while visiting my kids who attend college in Boston. The lobby is small, nothing fancy, but clean. There don't seem to be too many people working at this hotel, just the front desk clerk and a guy to take your car if you opt for the valet parking. The room I had was spacious and clean, with a nice sized bathroom. Mini-fridge was a nice touch, as was the coffee pot in the room. There is a breakfast served, and it's ok, but seems a little pricey (buffet is $18). Walk over to the Lenox Hotel for amazing waffles, pancakes or french toast for about $15; or the Pour House pub on Boylston St. is open for breakfast; good meal for surprisingly cheap (less than $10 gets you pancakes, eggs and coffee). Overall, if you need a clean good-sized room in a nice location in the heart of Back Bay, this place may have a good price; compare deals with the many surrounding hotels. But don't expect anything else. Parking across the street at Prudential is convenient but expensive. If you're willing to park a few blocks over on Westland Ave, you'll save $15 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JL254
Reviews.Content: Like many of the previous reviews, the hotel has a great location for tourists. A 2 minute walk and you are on Newbury Street which is a great area of Back Bay. Then a few more minutes and you are at the Public Garden and Boston Common. We loved the shower- big shower- no tub. The room was fine. The one draw back was the staff using the ice machine outside our room at 6am for 10 minutes, not allowing us to sleep in. Overall- it was a nice stay but a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLincs
Reviews.Content: Standard hotel accommodation with easy walking access to the touristy things we wanted to do during our two night stay. We breakfasted in the hotel, the all in menu was better value than picking individual items from the menu.

Reviews.Title: “a potential problem for staying this hotel”
Reviews.Author: yogidharma
Reviews.Content: Here is the problem. Our regulations require the folio (to get the reimbursement) but the hotel won't supply one if the reservation was made by a third party organizer and the third party organizers don't have the data to provide a folio. The hotel itself is great but they are not willing to solve the problems like the one I had.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_IrelandDanny
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in Boston at the Courtyard and loved it. Hotel is in a magic location, walking distance to seemingly everything we wanted to do in Boston. We had a 2 queen room which seemed very large, with a huge flat screen tv on the wall. The bathroom was nice, with a shower that had two shower heads, but only one would operate at a time(?!) Interestingly, there was a little laundry room next to the ice machine on the 2nd floor! A coin operated washing machine and dryer, with a big box of detergent! Very unusual, and handy too. The desk staff were superb, and we would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: rjmacf
Reviews.Content: Great choice for all of central Boston and Back Bay. Very smooth check in with pleasant staff and a great buffet breakfast. The rooms are great. Large enough for two adults and two teens. Shower a little counter intuitive for Europeans but hardly a big issue. Location as has been pointed out is superb with short walks to Boylston and Newbury St shopping. Easy stroll to Boston Common and if you want even through to Cambridgeshire Mall and Fanueil Hall. Subway is close if you prefer although stations being rebuilt this year and public AC not very effective/non existent. Would like to return. Costs very very reasonable for centre of a US city and much better than anything in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tsimmis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days and would stay there again. The location was great -- right in the middle of Copley Square, across from a grocery store and down the street from all the shops and restaurants, and right around the corner from the T.
