The staff was warm, friendly, helpful and accommodating. The room contained a small fridge. The rooms were clean, clean. The beds great, with nice linens. The hotel lobby almost felt like you were in a small European hotel, where you could go sit on a couch and have a coffee or tea (complimentary), watch tv, or use the computer. My daughter, who can't sleep, was perfectly fine, comfortable and safe going down late at night to make a cup of tea or surf the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: ACS76
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston for a 3 night stay with our 2 year old son. The hotel was in an amazing location and we could walk pretty much everywhere. It was close to shopping and dining experiences. The hotel itself was extremely clean and well kept and the staff was very friendly. The only drawback was that the size of the room was small for a king size bed and a pack and play, where my son slept. The bathroom was spacious and very clean, and the housekeeping was done in a very timely fashion. We would definately recommend this hotel for a great stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ustraveler100
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Courtyard Boston Copley Square! The hotel staff was warm and inviting upon check in. Our seventh floor corner room had a king bed and a decent sized bathroom with a great shower! The location was close to everything including Boston Common and the Freedom Trail. Beacon Hill and Fenway Park were a short walk away along with the shops and restaurants of Newbury Street . The hotel is only two blocks from a "T" station which makes getting around easier if your feet are tired. We would definitely stay here again while visiting Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Courtyard Copley Square!!!”
Reviews.Author: uofabecca
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this Courtyard. The location could not have been better. This was our first trip to Boston, we wanted to be in the middle of everything and this hotel is. Walking distance to almost everything. The staff was courteous and accomodating. Our room was spacious and comfortable- the bathroom was a good size and there was plenty of water pressure in the shower:) Exceded our expectations in every way. Definately worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Sanctuary, but Service Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: This is an older building, but the rooms and bathrooms are a decent size, at least for one. Two people might get a little claustrophobic, especially if one is my girlfriend. The hotel is centrally located and easily accessible by T (Copley Station). Lots of places to eat nearby. I had a nice quiet room with bay windows, a king size bed, and a large bathroom - Room 605. It felt like a nice quiet sanctuary after a long day's travel or work. Front desk clerk was very friendly and accommodating, allowing me to check in at 11:00 a.m. on my first day. Unfortunately, that was partially offset on the last day by a failure to cancel my wake up call as requested - a pet peeve. Housekeeping repeatedly screwed up (didn't put away the ironing board, left water in the coffee maker from previous tenant, didn't replenish the packs of coffee, failed to clean the coffee maker - they must have something against caffeine). Finally I never could figure out how to set the thermostat - there seemed to be only two settings - "on" (or "Arctic"), and "off". I left it off and was comfortable in early June. I will probably stay here again when business takes me to Copley Place. I prefer staying here to the hotels which are physically located in the mall - this Courtyard seems quieter and less hectic. Bottom line is the facilities are fine, but the service needs work.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, nice staff but nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal401
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on business at the end of March/beginning of April. The first night I was in a room next to the stairs that was so small the tv was on the side of the bed (ie I had to lay in bed and turn my head to the side to watch it). Room window looked onto a brick wall, no fridge, the temperature control was broken and I heard the two heavy stairwell doors slamming all night. Beware the room next to the stairs! Staff was very accomodating the next day and switched me to another room immediately. Most staff was very nice and friendly, remembered me. My second room was much larger, window looked onto actual view, had a fridge, working temp control, etc. Much nicer. The hotel was very clean, pleasant enough though pretty generic mid-tier chain hotel. Thought the breakfast buffet was included but it costs $15. A little pricey. Go to Au Bon Pain or one of the myriad of other places near by instead if you want to eat quickly and more cost effectively. Free hi-speed internet access in the room (but not wi-fi) was nice to have. Overall, perfectly fine but nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Abel73
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard by Marriott at Copley Square is located in the city center where there is lots to see and do within walking distance, including shopping, dining, city tours and entertainment. Metro is also just a couple of blocks away, which is a convenient way of getting around the city. The hotel itself is a 10 story building, over 100 years old with lots of character and charm from the outside. However, rooms have been recently remodeled and are clean, bright and very comfortable with all the amenities you would expect from a 21st century hotel of this class. There is complementary internet access in every room. They also have an exercise room, but I have not been there during this visit. The hotel lobby is small but modern looking and clean, with a lounge area and large TV screen. The staff is friendly and checking in was a snap. There are also complementary daily activities at around 5 pm including chocolate, beer and tea tasting (a nice touch). Overall, I am very pleased with my experience at this hotel and highly recommend it to any one visiting Boston for either business or pleasure alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BTraveling47
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. It is located on Exeter Street in Back Bay which is within an easy walking distance of the Prudential Center and Copley Place; the T (subway) station, the Back Bay train station; Newbury Street shopping; and too many restaurants & lounges to mention. It definately has the cozy feel of a boutique hotel. The front desk staff should be commended for the service they provide to their guests. They are extremely friendly and helpful. Housekeeping does a terrific job -- our lovely room was spotless. The breakfast restaurant is bright, cheerful and the buffet is yummy. Service was excellent. We booked through the AAA website and received an very reasonable rate. You will love this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: londongal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of Nov/beginning of Dec and I can't fault the hotel or its wonderful staff. They were so helpful in all aspects of our stay, and seemed genuinely pleased to be able to help us. In a great location, with lots of places nearby easily walkable. Don't expect a large lobby, but also don't let this put you off.

Reviews.Title: “cute little "boutique" style hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolabarney
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights in Nov/07. THE GOOD: interesting little (100 rooms or so) hotel with a boutique feel. nice quirky rooms, all are different, as this was originally an apt. building (built about 100 years ago). Windows are large and they open. Get a room higher up if noise bothers you as this is right downtown. Great location very close walk to the subway and lots of restaurants and upscale shops. Compared to other hotels nearby (the Lenox, etc), your money goes a little further here. Staff seems genuinely pleasant, not just going through the routines. Rooms were done in 2004 but are holding up well. Bathroom was large with lots of clean towels, granite counters, strong water pressure in the shower and toiletries of a quality that you would expect from a mid-scale chain. free use of internet in the lobby and free cookies/fruit in the afternoon at the front desk. Breakfast buffet has sufficient choices and the kitchen and service staff did a great job of keeping everyone happy. Even the cook came out to see if we needed anything. THE BAD: a few too many stray hairs on the bathroom floor (which always drives me crazy). An extra blanket in the closet would have been nice, as our room was cold, especially when you sat next to the window. it was my second visit here and hopefully if we go back to Boston, we will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Option in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: skmp1117
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard at Copley Square is a great hotel with a great location in the Back Bay. It's less expensive than the other hotels in the area (Westin's around the corner and Lenox Hotel across the street) and you still get more for your money. Our package included free hot breakfast each morning of our stay. The rooms seem newly rennovated, are very clean and the beds are very comfortable. We were in Boston to see Boston, so we didn't need the extra services that might come with a Westin or larger Marriott, as we were out and about most of the time. We even had a very early flight for which the front desk arranged a car service to pick us up for the airport at 4:30. All in all, great service, great breakfast, great beds and rooms and a very reasonable rate for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, location and accomidations!”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshireSusieQ4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week and was very impressed by the size and comfort of the rooms, the cleanliness, the location and the extra amenities offered by the hotel staff. Being right in downtown Boston and within walking distance of the shops on Newbury Street, the Boston Public Garden and the Copley Place was a wonderful treat. It was even better that the cost was not exorbitant and the rooms were beautiful appointed. There were also great extras such as a chocolate fountain in the hotel lobby for guests to partake in on Tuesday early evenings accompanied by the movie Willie Wonka on a flat screen TV for the kids. I highly recommend this hotel and I will certainly look to stay there again. Great valet parking too - and no more cost than what the parking garage would be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: nathalie27
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few days in June. Great location. Valet parking. close to the T. close to Newbury. Supermarket across the street,Clean room, very quiet, Alitte pricy but if you want to stay in that area, it's the price to pay. Would not hesitate in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: mtmsells
Reviews.Content: I was deeply disappointed in their service. I was promised a specific hotel room and when I arrived, they said they did not have those types of rooms at their hotel. The confirmation sent by the Marriot stated that I would be given the room promised. No attempts were made by the hotel to fix the situatuion.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel close to t stop and duck tour”
Reviews.Author: bethpage28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a few days in early July.Everything was great with this hotel valet parking across the street,low vehicle traffic on the street, around the corner was a Shaw supermarket,the Duck Tours start around the corner also.Two blocks away was Newbury Street with alot of outside restaurants, a little pricey.T stop block and half away.Two stops to the Boston Commons and three stops to Fenway Park.Room was a nice corner king room on the 9 floor.Very clean and had a little refigerator did not keep things real cold.AAA package came with breakfast buffet every morning.The normal charge for the buffet is $ 15 dollars.Would stay at this hotel the next time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: robills
Reviews.Content: Loved the Courtyard! I booked this hotel through expedia because we got a good rate (for Boston) 170 bucks (canadian) a night with the Godiva Getaway package. Was a quick 10-15 min trip from the aiport, taxi driver didn't have any problems finding it. Taxi ride was 21.95 not including tip. We took the T back to the airport since we still had our Charlie Cards to use. Front desk was quick and friendly, they were great with directions too. The room was clean and fresh, beds and pillows were the best. The best part was the breakfast (included with the godiva package), it was fabulous. Bacon, sausage, eggs, belgian waffles with WARM REAL maple syrup as well as your regular toast, bagels, cereals and beverages. More than adequate. It was also convienient to the Copley T stop (right around the corner about a 5 min walk). We took the T everywhere, very easy to figure out. Many things are also within walking distance...Newbury Street, Prudential Centre, Boston Common, etc. Great hotel, great comfort, great staff, superb breakfast, good location. I would definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise off Copley”
Reviews.Author: MadTownTraveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice but small hotel very near the larger Marriott Copley Place. Hard to locate -- my cabbie tried to drop me at the main Courtyard by Marriott downtown. Evidently, this hotel was recently rebranded as a Courtyard. The rooms were normal large-city sized rooms -- in other words, they were a bit small. But for one person or a couple, they are fine. The shower was excellent - large with a good spray. All the room amenities were fairly new and functional. The bed was veyr comfortable and the room very quiet. The only complaints were that the room was quite cold. The thermostat seemed stuck on full air conditioning. This is NOT a full service hotel. No bar or restaurant, but there is much nearby. Cabs are not easy to catch; it's on a side street, but the bellman ran a block away to get me one. Hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. Nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Boston Copley Square Worth a Look”
Reviews.Author: Beach710
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights over Memorial Day Weekend. We got a really good AAA discount. The room was nice enough but no refrigerator as stated on the website. Housekeeping was good enough and did leave extra towels as requested. Free Samuel Adams beer on Thursday night was fun. The location is really great, close to the Duck Tour, close to a couple of malls and Newbury Street. Within walking distance to Copley Square and the Bostix booth. We walked to Boston Common and the Public Gardens, no problem. I have to admit after reading the excellent reviews I was just a little disappointed. I was definitely expecting too much! I think maybe the sign stating you can get a free $5 Starbucks gift certificate for a Tripadvisor review may be part of the reason for the great reviews. There were a couple of minor negatives: there are a couple of stairs at the entrance of the hotel we had to drag our suitcases up. I donâ€™t know why it is not a ramp. One of the front desk employees was not very friendly. There were some really strange noises in the room; fortunately only the last night did the noise actually disturb our sleep. We were on the 10th floor, trying to avoid the street noise but I think it was a mistake. Overall for the price I would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved the convenience”
Reviews.Author: psf4kids
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The hotel was very clean and convenient to various restaurants, the T, and tourist attractions. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We hope to stay here again in the near future.
